channel.description: Recent content in Shameless on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: The real affair story behind Love Actually | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, everyone! We all know the story of Emma Thompson’s character in Love Actually being cheated on. But do you know the real-life affair story that led to the collapse of her first marriage? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Let your skin take centre stage and find your skin type and CeraVe skincare routine on the CeraVe website.

item.title: Justin Deruuuloooo | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, friends! On today’s show: Taylor Swift is named TIME’s Person of the Year and takes a shot at Kim Kardashian in the process. There’s a royal photoshop fail in Will and Kate’s family Christmas card, Selena Gomez is in a relationship and letting loose in the comments section, Molly-Mae Hague says she’s “going through it”, and Hugh Grant is kinda grumpy but needs money, okay? This week, Zara recommended watching the Actors on Actors interviews with Variety.

item.title: Lena Dunham’s mea culpas: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, everybody! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Lena Dunham. She has a brilliant mind and a knack for pissing people off. Lena is behind some of our generation’s most celebrated work, but also cringeworthy blunders. How the hell did she get so famous? And what do we make of her now? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: … Fleabag? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Why hello, everyone! On today’s show: remember the ‘wedding of the century’ that we spoke about last week? Yeah, well… it turns out the groom could be looking at decades behind bars. Plus! Publicist Tree Paine has taken a big old whack at professional celebrity gossiper DeuxMoi, Billie Eilish has called out Variety for ‘outing her’, and friend of the show Dave Galafassi is BACK!!! Then we’re doing a slow news week!

item.title: Lena Dunham’s mea culpas: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, everyone! Lena Dunham has a brilliant mind and a knack for pissing people off. She’s behind some of our generation’s most celebrated work, but also cringeworthy blunders. How the hell did she get so famous? And what do we make of her now? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible. Head online to Mejuri for all your holiday needs, or head to the pop-up at Incu in Sydney and Melbourne to shop IRL until December 10.

item.title: Versailles, aquarium, potato potahto! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo, everybody! On today’s show: videos of Tommy Fury partying it up with Chris Brown in Dubai are making us feel… a lot of things. The wedding of the century is here and the TikToks are something else, the main takeaways from Kylie Jenner’s interview with Jennifer Lawrence, Diddy has been accused of sexual assault by two more women, and the British podcast that unwittingly cancelled the impending wedding of a major influencer.

item.title: Just... Justin Timberlake: Part three | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, legends! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Justin Timberlake. Just saying his name is enough to elicit a reaction. For some, he’s the hitmaker who turned boy band adoration into pop superstardom. For others, he’s the prime example of everything to dislike in a celebrity. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Lo Bros for making this episode possible.

item.title: Happy Madison | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, everyone! On today’s show: From the curious marketing campaign behind Anyone But You and The Curse, Suki Waterhouse announced she’s pregnant mid-performance, rapper Cassie accuses Diddy of sexual assault and abuse, reviews of The Crown season six are in and they are… emphatically negative, Travis Kelce has been profiled by the Wall Street Journal, and Kanye West’s Australian wife Bianca Censori might now be his ex. This week, Zara recommended this piece in the New York Times about the recent shut down of the site, Jezebel.

item.title: Just... Justin Timberlake: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, everyone! Welcome to the second part of our series on Justin Timberlake. Just saying his name is enough to elicit a reaction. For some, he’s the hitmaker who turned boy band adoration into pop superstardom. For others, he’s the prime example of everything to dislike in a celebrity. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible.

item.title: Take’n or leavin | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! On today’s show: What’s going on with the reports suggesting Prince Frederick has cheated on Australia’s Princess Mary? Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are giving us big romcom energy and we can’t get enough, there’s widespread mourning for Harry Styles’s hair, Mean Girls 2.0 is just around the corner, and Kim Kardashian’s hairdresser files for divorce - literal days after his televised wedding was watched by millions.

item.title: Just... Justin Timberlake: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, friends! Justin Timberlake: just saying his name is enough to elicit a reaction. For some, he’s the hitmaker who turned boy band adoration into pop superstardom. For others, he’s the prime example of everything to dislike in a celebrity. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Chadstone - The Fashion Capital - for making this episode possible. Discover extended hours, shopping guides and real-time parking info at chadstone.

item.title: In our French Girl Phase | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, friends! On today’s show: Troye Sivan’s fast becoming the most exciting celebrity to follow right now, Alexa Chung has shared her 40 best pieces of life advice and we are obsessed, Sophie Turner has entered her French Girl Phase, people think Emma Chamberlain should go to college, and it’s time to play Slow News Week again! This week, Mich recommended watching Love Triangle on Stan. Zara recommended The Buccaneers on Apple TV+, as well as the six-part podcast series from Schwartz Media, ‘Rupert: The Last Mogul’.

item.title: The Call Her Daddy breakup: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Helloooo! Welcome to the second and final part of our Call Her Daddy series. They were two of the biggest names in podcasting. Together, Sofia Franklyn and Alex Cooper built a brand known around the world. But as fame, money, and attention came their way, the friendship that started it all completely crumbled. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible.

item.title: Craving a pure, raw electric guitar | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, everyone! On today’s show: 1989 Taylor’s Version is here, but a Harry Styles cameo is not. The world mourns the death of FRIENDS star, Matthew Perry, there are whispers in DeuxMoi that another celebrity divorce is brewing, Kylie Jenner has launched Khy and it’s, well, kind of genius. And then: how the hell did Martin Scorcese become TikTok’s new… it boy? This week, Zara recommended Green Dot by Madeline Gray.

item.title: The Call Her Daddy breakup: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! They were two of the biggest names in podcasting. Together, Sofia Franklyn and Alex Cooper built a brand known around the world. But as fame, money, and attention came their way, the friendship that started it all completely crumbled. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Thanks to SBS On Demand for making this episode possible. Head to SBS On Demand to stream Erotic Stories for free now.

item.title: The PFPE | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo, everyone! On today’s show: Britney Spears’s memoir is finally out in the world, so what are the key takeaways from one of the most anticipated books of the last year? Plus, Sophia Bush has reportedly moved on with a former soccer star and, well, where do we start with the drama around that story? Then, Rebecca Loos isn’t happy with David Beckham’s documentary and Meryl Streep’s marriage also falls victim to 2023.

item.title: The many iterations of Ariana Grande: Part three | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, everybody! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Ariana Grande. She was the superstar who navigated a terrorist attack and the death of a former partner within 18 months. Ariana Grande had dealt with unimaginable heartbreak. By 2018, she was a bit of a phoenix, rising from the ashes. Only, the story was far from over. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: Hidden nuances, subtle beauties, etc! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, friends! On today’s show: Well, we simply must talk about Will and Jada and the news that… actually… they’ve not been together since 2016. Plus, the questions we have after Kendall Jenner took a sizeable paycheck from Mark Zuckerberg, why on earth have Sophie Turner and Priyanka Chopra Jonas unfollowed each other, and then, Julia Fox’s very candid memoir. Oh, and you bet we’re bringing back by popular demand SLOW NEWS WEEK, which is a win for podcast segment inventors everywhere.

item.title: The best advice we’ve ever received | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Well well well, what do we have here? This is a very special bonus episode to celebrate the fact that our new book, 4am, is out in the world today. Since 2021, tens of thousands of readers have devoured ASK SHAMELESS’s weekly columns on dating, friendship and self-development, written by Mich and Zara, along with our incredible roster of guest columnists. The book doesn’t just look beautiful, it also features ten brand new columns from Mich and Zara, and is available to read in hardback and audio book.

item.title: The many iterations of Ariana Grande: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, everyone! Welcome to part two of our series on Ariana Grande. A gig on Broadway, a Nickelodeon show, and a voice so powerful it was considered once in a generation: Ariana Grande was on the path to superstardom. But 2017 would show the singer just how awful - how heartbreaking - fame can be. For the link to BBC’s tribute to the Manchester attack victims, head here. To donate to Winston’s Wish, head here.

item.title: A wee mea culpa | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, everyone! On today’s show: the Beckham documentary has been released and we have oh so many thoughts, it appears that Gigi Hadid and Bradley Cooper are Hollywood’s newest couple, Emma Chamberlain is single, all of social media is theorising that Andy Cohen and John Mayer are more than friends, Olivia Wilde’s Instagram activity is under the microscope, and then finally: why did TikTok’s It Girl Matilda Djerf deactivate her account this week?

item.title: The many iterations of Ariana Grande: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! She’s found herself in one of the biggest celebrity headlines of 2023. But long before her divorce from Dalton Gomez, pop star Ariana Grande had an extremely colourful life, with twists and turns that we can’t quite comprehend. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Hayu for making this episode possible. Head to hayu.com or download the app to start your free trial now.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham: A special from the archives | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description SURPRISE! We’re so excited to be bringing you this special, jam-packed episode from the archives. As you’ve probably noticed, the Beckham documentary has just dropped on Netflix and is going absolutely wild right now. We binged it, and at the end of the docu-series thought: you know what? We did our own three-part series on David and Victoria Beckham’s marriage years ago. It’s one of our favorite scandal series of all time and has a lot of information about the celebrity side of David and Victoria Beckham that might not have been covered in the documentary series.

item.title: Girl summer? Willy nilly winter! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya, friends! On today’s show: that Kim and Kourtney Kardashian phone call and what we make of the speculation that Travis Barker is actually at the heart of it all. Olivia Wilde and Jason Sudeikis quietly bury the hatchet, an episode of Dax Shepard’s podcast attracted some ugly headlines, we need to talk about the rise of the “girl’s girl”, and then, Zara’s got a brand new segment!!! This week, Mich recommended ‘Who Killed Jill Dando?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Grace Beverley | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, pals! Today we are joined by Youtuber turned entrepreneur Grace Beverley. For the unacquainted, Grace is a force to be reckoned with. Grace blew up when she was studying at Oxford and decided to document her life with vlogs on YouTube. From there, she channeled her incredibly engaged audience into not one, but two, business ventures: a sustainable activewear brand called TALA and a fitness company called Shreddy.

item.title: The college admissions scandal: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi, everybody! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on the college admissions scandal. Olivia Jade was the ultimate aspirational Gen Z-er: the daughter of an actress and multi-millionaire entrepreneur – and an influencer with millions of followers to her name – she… kind of had it all. That is, until the US Department of Justice came knocking. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: Every 1.6... days? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! On today’s show: Sophie Turner sues Joe Jonas and shows him what magnificent PR looks like, Taylor Swift wants you to know who Travis Kelce is, Emma Roberts has been accused of transphobia by a former costar, and we absolutely need to talk about the Netflix romcom that we watched and absolutely adored this week. Zara recommended Imogen Heap’s newsletter article, ‘A Day With Taylor’, and ‘Say It To My Face’ from This American Life.

item.title: Taylor Swift and Karlie Kloss: a Sentimental Garbage crossover | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya, friends! Today, Mich and Caroline (and producer Annabelle!) turn their attention to something you’ve all been demanding from us: a deep dive into Taylor Swift and Karlie Kloss, and what the hell happened to their friendship. You guys know that commentary around Taylor and Karlie has run rampant for years, so while we won’t get too deeply in the weeds of every single internet hole, consider this episode a wide-ranging pop culture exploration… what is the commentary about Taylor and Karlie?

item.title: The college admissions scandal: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! Olivia Jade was the ultimate aspirational Gen Z-er: the daughter of an actress and multi-millionaire entrepreneur – and an influencer with millions of followers to her name – she… kind of had it all. That is, until the US Department of Justice came knocking. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Disney+ and the all-new season of The Kardashians for making this episode possible.

item.title: Tinkerbell’s dad | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, mates! On today’s show: Hugh Jackman and Deborra-Lee Furness’s marriage is over and the world (well, mostly our mothers) is mourning, Russell Brand says the mainstream media is out to get him after he is accused of multiple sexual assaults, and who and what is a Tube Girl? Plus, no - Paul Mescal is not Daisy Edgar Jones’s new boyfriend, Drew Barrymore faces backlash for returning to work and are the men OK?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Dolly Alderton | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Why hello, everyone! Today, we are joined by one of the UK’s most prominent authors, Dolly Alderton. Some of you might be thinking, but wait! You guys have already interviewed Dolly! And you’d be right. Back in 2020, in the depths of lockdown, we spoke to Dolly over Zoom about her life and career. But, given how much we adore her, and given how she was so highly requested by you guys, we thought: why not make her the first person to ever return to Shameless In Conversation?

item.title: The drama of Dance Moms: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Helloooo, friends! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on the drama of Dance Moms. It was the reality TV show that captured the world’s attention: a group of very young girls, their overbearing mothers, and a dance coach so intense, some called her methods abusive. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible.

item.title: Ashton, Mila, and their “role model” Danny | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! On today’s show: we have quite a few updates about the Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas divorce. Jimmy Fallon is the latest talk show host to be outed as a terrible boss, the video going viral after the VMAS, and finally: we do a massive deep dive on everything there is to know about Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis asking a judge for leniency after their friend was found guilty of raping two women.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Steven Bartlett | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! Welcome to the first episode of our very special In Conversation series. Today on the show, we are joined by one of the most recognisable business and media personalities in Britain, Steven Bartlett. In 2014, he co-founded a social media marketing agency called Social Chain, which cemented the then-22-year-old as one of the leaders in the social media marketing world. Three years later, he created his podcast, The Diary of a CEO, which is one of the biggest podcasts in the UK right now.

item.title: The drama of Dance Moms: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Heeeyyy, everyone! It was the reality TV show that captured the world’s attention: a group of very young girls, their overbearing mothers, and a dance coach so intense, some called her methods abusive. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to 20th Century Studios ‘A Haunting in Venice’ for making this episode possible. A Haunting in Venice is out on September the 14th so grab your mates and head to the cinemas.

item.title: It’s celebrity divorce-ageddon | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya, pals! On today’s show: what the hell happened in Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner’s marriage? We unpack the latest celebrity divorce announcement of 2023. Then! Olivia Rodrigo anxiously answers whether her new single is a jab at Taylor Swift, Kylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet make their public debut as a couple, and we absolutely need to discuss how Justin Bieber’s sartorial choices became the fixation of TikTok this week.

item.title: The Tiger Woods affairs: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, everyone! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Tiger Woods. Tiger Woods was changing the world of sport and earning $80 million a year when the National Enquirer followed him into a car park with mistress Mindy Lawton. He managed to kill that story. But soon, his luck would completely run out. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: Not the reverse Steven Bradbury | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, everybody! On today’s show: We’ve officially entered the era of the rebrand - from strawberry girl aesthetic to tomato girl fall, so what the hell is going on? It’s official: We single-handedly manifested a Stormzy and Maya Jama reunion, an update on what the hell is up with Scooter Braun, unpacking the viral controversy around that Che Diaz profile, and Pete Davidson is single again. This week, Zara had two recommendations: this episode on Oprah from Acquired and The Intern on Netflix.

item.title: The Tiger Woods affairs: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! He was utterly adored around the world. Tiger Woods was young, handsome and wildly talented – and he had an adorable family to boot. Only, as so often is the case in celebrity land, the higher you climb, the harder you fall. You can watch the two-part Tiger Woods documentary on Binge right here, and check out Tiger Woods’s biography here. Big thanks to kikki K for making this episode possible.

item.title: Scootin' away from Scooter | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! On today’s show: three of Scooter Braun’s biggest stars have all reportedly left him within the space of a week, so what the hell is going on? Plus, everything we know about Britney Spears and Sam Asghari’s ugly divorce, Jack Antonoff had a star-studded wedding to Margaret Qualley, people are very, very irritated by Disney’s live-action remake of Snow White and are taking its young star to task, and - finally!

item.title: Gwyneth, Goop, and everything else: Part three | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, everyone! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Gwyneth Paltrow. By 2008, Gwyneth Paltrow had conquered Hollywood. Her next frontier - her wellness company, goop - would prove more controversial, and indeed successful, than everything before it combined. Big thanks to 20th Century Studios and ‘A Haunting in Venice’ for making this episode possible. To celebrate the release of the film we will be asking our community to share their very own whodunit stories for their chance to win tickets to a private screening here in Melbourne on the 14th of September.

item.title: Sublime! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, everyone! On today’s show: Karlie Kloss made a curious appearance in the nosebleeds section of the Eras Tour, adding another chapter to the world’s most cryptic celebrity feud. The team that works at an American magazine has had a headline nightmare, it seems all of TikTok is mourning the death of Anna Paul’s relationship, Aussie label Zimmermann sells for a billion dollars and what the hell do we make of Lil Tay’s supposed “Instagram hacking” scandal?

item.title: Gwyneth, Goop, and everything else: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, everyone! By her mid-twenties, Gwyneth Paltrow had leveraged her star-studded upbringing into a glittering career; she was winning Oscars, dating world-famous men, and captivating the tabloid media. And, she was about to meet someone who’d change her life: Coldplay’s Chris Martin. Big thanks to KX Pilates for making this episode possible. You can try KX Pilates today for just $12 a class with their intro offer: that’s 5 classes for $60.

item.title: The curse continues | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooo, everyone! On today’s show: Lizzo, Lizzo, Lizzo. The Grammy-award-winning pop star has been accused of some rather dodgy behaviour in a lawsuit from three of her former employees. Then! How did Sophia Bush go from gushing about her husband in June, to filing for divorce in August? Bella Hadid addresses the rumours she’s been in rehab, Natalie Portman is probably single again, and the arts and craft section of TikTok is at war and Mich cannot look away.

item.title: Gwyneth, Goop, and everything else: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! Sure, there’s GOOP. But before Gwyneth Paltrow made waves in the wellness space, she was an A-list actress on a trajectory to full-blown stardom. And her life story? Well, it’s just about as jam-packed as they come. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. If you want to win $50,000, spend $50 or more at eliteelevensporting.com or download the app for quick and easy checkout.

item.title: Ummm, where do we begin? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh, you bet we’re back. On today’s show: Well, just about everything. While we were gone two celebrity couples filed for divorce and another broke off their engagement, Jonah Hill’s ex-girlfriend leaked his texts and accused him of being a narcissist, childhood best friends Kylie Jenner and Jordyn Woods repaired their four-year rift, Twitter became ‘X’ and gained a new competitor ‘Threads’, Doja Cat offended half a million people, and TikTok’s IT Girl got sprung kissing a teenager.

item.title: Ashton and Demi: Part three | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Demi and Ashton. For a time, the tabloids could not stop talking about Demi Moore and Ashton Kutcher’s 15-year age gap. Eventually, though, they were distracted by something much juicier: Ashton’s alleged infidelity. Big thanks to the musical Wicked for making this episode possible. To watch the ‘musical with brains, heart and courage’ as described by TIME Magazine then head to WickedtheMusical.

item.title: Ashton and Demi: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, everyone! Welcome to part two of our series on Ashton and Demi. Demi Moore and Bruce Willis ruled the late 80s and 90s, but eventually, their marriage crumbled. It was the man Demi married next - a boyish, rambunctious prankster named Ashton Kutcher - that would have the whole world talking. Big thanks to Pureology’s Color Fanatic Multi-Tasking Leave-In Spray for making this episode possible. If you want to add this spray to your routine you can find it in your local Pureology Salon, or online via Adore Beauty.

item.title: Ashton and Demi: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, mates! Demi Moore was one of the hottest celebrities of the 80s, 90s, and noughties. But the road to stardom - and the heartbreaks along the way - may surprise even her biggest fans. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Find their extensive range online at Adore Beauty and in-store or online at Chemist Warehouse. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: We have news | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description The Shameless Book Club is getting its own nook and boy are we excited to tell you all about it. Find out more on Instagram or TikTok. Transcript

item.title: Chad and Sophia's five-month marriage | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, friends! They were the young and beautiful actors that ruled the mid-noughties on One Tree Hill. But the calamitous end to Sophia Bush and Chad Michael Murray’s marriage would have people asking questions for years to come. For that link to the Mark Schwahn piece in Variety that we mentioned at the top of this episode, head here. Big thanks to Hayu and the brand new season of Below Deck Down Under for making this episode possible.

item.title: Everybody has a Taylor ticket story | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! On today’s show: The Barbie marketing campaign is well and truly amping up and it’s all we can talk about in the Shameless Media office, why is Blake Lively facing backlash over the release of her new Betty Booze cocktails, what’s going on with all these rumours Kyle Richards and her marriage and then, we unpack the most perfectly timed mailbag: is it OK to not want to sell Taylor Swift tickets to someone you don’t deem a big enough fan?

item.title: The fight for Sofia Vergara’s embryos: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, mates! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Sofia Vergara. Her breakup at the age of 41 went far beyond what we’ve seen for almost any celebrity. You see, Sofia’s ex wanted to have her children, and as the ensuing years would prove, he’d stop at nothing to do it. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: A sushi scandal | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Update: In an earlier version of this episode, Mich accidentally said “Olivia” instead of Sophia Culpo. That error has been amended. Hello, legends! On today’s show: Is Jennifer Lawrence’s new movie as problematic as some people are saying it is? Molly-Mae steps down from a role that many found controversial to begin with, how the Glastonbury crowd had Lewis Capaldi’s back and Alix Earle’s soft-launching her new boyfriend has kicked off quite the TikTok controversy.

item.title: The fight for Sofia Vergara’s embryos: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, friends! Sofia Vergara’s breakup at the age of 41 went far beyond what we’ve seen for almost any celebrity. You see, Sofia’s ex wanted to have her children, and as the ensuing years would prove, he’d stop at nothing to do it. Big thanks to Audible for making this episode possible. Download the Audible app to browse their audiobooks, podcasts, and Audible Originals when you download the Audible app and start listening today.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Really Good, Actually | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6Na2UkzFL8yHDL3G5BFMVc?si=923b6e8b022442d7 Hello, book clubbers! This month, we read Monica Heisey’s debut novel: Really Good, Actually. The book is told through the eyes of Maggie - a 29-year-old whose marriage ended just 608 days after it started. Sure, she’s alone for the first time in her life, can’t afford her rent and her obscure PhD is going nowhere, but she’s reaaaally good.

item.title: Grifters and daddies | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey! On today’s show: Taylor Swift is coming to Australia, Kourtney Kardashian is pregnant and announced it in quite the creative way, and Harry and Meghan part ways with Spotify amid being called “grifters”. Plus, Kayla Itsines speaks of her split from her fiance and business partner Tobi Pearce, and then can we talk about Daddy’s Day? This week, Mich recommended watching Shiny Happy People on Amazon Prime.

item.title: The YouTuber series: Logan and Jake Paul (Part two) | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello! Two brothers, tens of millions of followers, and too many “diss track videos” to count. Logan and Jake Paul were controversial for sure. But by the end of 2017? They’d encounter a scandal so serious, it’s a wonder their careers survived. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Bang, bang, bang | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooo, everyone! On today’s show: Mich watched The Idol so you don’t have to, so what does she actually think? Plus, Leo and Gigi seem to be back on again but the press is getting a little confused by it all, Amy Schumer has an issue with all those celebrities on Ozempic, another bizarre celebrity couple enters the cosmos, and then, Jennifer Coolidge’s advice for life. item.title: The 2022 SEOYAs | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, everybody! On today’s show: the 2022 SEOYAs - that is, the 2022 Shameless End of Year Awards. Today, we’re recapping some of our favourite recommendations of the year, and we’re looking back at the pop culture stories that shaped 2022. We’re also going to share with you a little bit of ‘behind the scenes’ - what segments we loved, what we have slight regret about maybe, and what we’re taking away from the year.

This month, we read ‘The Island of Missing Trees’ by award-winning Turkish-British author Elif Shafak. The book follows the love story between two teenagers, Kostas (a Greek Cypriot) and Defne (a Turkish Cypriot), whose forbidden romance means they can only meet at a taverna on the island between their homes. Witnessing their relationship through its ebbs and flows over the many years this story encompasses, is the fig tree that lives inside the taverna - the place of safety for Kostas and Defne.

item.title: The year that was | Shameless

Plus, we name our top read, watch, and listen recommendations from the year that was, look back at our favourite podcast moments, and share the lessons we’ll be taking with us into 2022.

This month, we took on our first non-fiction book, a memoir from the now 28-year-old North Korean defector and activist, Yeonmi Park. Published in 2015, Yeonmi tells the story of the first 22 years of her life - from her first 13 years growing up in North Korea as it was consumed by famine, to fleeing over the border to China where she and her mother fell into the hands of human traffickers, and finally, to escaping to South Korea by traversing through the Gobi desert through the night in search of a better life.

We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: New Animal | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/29lWc3nOaDhqTcWWbSVVhd?si=d03076672f414219 Happy Saturday, book clubbers! This month, we read the debut novel ‘New Animal’ by Australian author Ella Baxter. This book, set initially in the Northern Rivers of New South Wales, then later in suburban Tasmania, follows the life of Amelia Aurelia; an embalmer who spends her days in funeral homes, painting the faces of the dead, and nights sleeping with strangers via the dating apps on her phone.

item.title: Jen, Brad and Ange: Part three | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya everyone! Welcome to part three of our Jen, Brad and Ange series. When Brad and Angelina’s stars combined it made for the most powerful celebrity couple of the modern era. But when they turned on each other? Well, the world is still feeling the aftershocks, five years later. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Won't somebody please think of the children! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi friends! On today’s show: Kanye West has officially moved on from his marriage to Kim Kardashian, Megan Thee Stallion’s music video is equal parts mesmerising and traumatising, Chrissy Teigen would like to apologise, G Flip says they’re a “gender smoothie” and THEN!!!! The Em Rata Instagram photo that caused such a stir, people can’t stop talking about it a week later. This week, Zara recommended David Tennant’s podcast interview with Olivia Colman.

item.title: Jen, Brad and Ange: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday wonderful people! Welcome to part two of our Jen, Brad and Ange series. Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt were Hollywood’s chosen two. Only, when Brad signed the dotted line to star in a movie called Mr. and Mrs. Smith, their public and personal lives would, quite literally, never look the same again. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Welcome to Gossips Anonymous | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Goooood morning! On today’s show: We’re sorry to say but there’s a TikTok beekeeper feud that has the internet a-buzzing and we’re going to get you across it all. Plus, there’s another royal Lilibet on the scene, the controversy enveloping Australian Fashion Week this week, and then, are we bad people for loving a big old gossip? This week, Mich recommended ABC’s Love On The Spectrum. Zara recommended watching Broadchurch.

item.title: Jen, Brad and Ange: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya friends! Today, we’re heading back to the 90s. They were the golden couple of all golden couples. Her, an all-American television star. Him, the world’s sexiest film heartthrob. So, when Jen and Brad’s perfect love story disintegrated in front of the eyes of the world, people wanted answers. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: The one with the Friends reunion | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello lovelies!!! On today’s show: Why The Veronicas didn’t talk for a year, Kylie and Travis are officially back on, Amy Schumer goes rogue on Instagram, and then! A biiiig bumper segment on the Friends reunion - how it became the biggest celebrity moment of the month, and what we make of the debate about whether the show is too outdated to be loved in 2021. This week, Zara recommended watching Mare of Easttown.

item.title: The life and death of Natalie Wood: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey there! Welcome to part two of our Natalie Wood series. Natalie Wood, one of Hollywood’s most iconic stars, had a fear of dark water. How could it be, then, that her body was found one mile away from the boat where she was holidaying with her husband and rumoured lover? Find that Vanity Fair article we mentioned in today’s episode here. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share?

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Swing Time | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/58cNGnSxs2NfIyseoL1Wjk?si=592094155913438f Happy Saturday, book clubbers! This month, we tucked into Swing Time by Zadie Smith, a novel that tells the story of two girls growing up on the wrong side of London. They meet at a community dance class and dream of being dancers, but only one of them has the talent. The blurb told us it was a tale of “friendships that anchor us, define us and change us forever”, but do we feel that line adequately explained what the book was about?

item.title: An iconic throuple | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday legends! On today’s show: A relatively unexpected celebrity throuple and why an interview with Princess Diana from 26 years ago is making headlines again. Plus, a history-making Bachelorette and why Billy Porter’s recent interview with the Hollywood Reporter is one of our favourite celebrity pieces in, well, a long time. This week, Mich recommended watching Celebrity Apprentice Australia and listening to Olivia Rodrigo’s new album, SOUR. Zara recommended the podcast episode of Ladies, We Need To Talk called ‘The rage in my pelvis’.

item.title: The life and death of Natalie Wood: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello friends! Today, we’re heading back to the 1950s and ‘60s. Natalie Wood was an icon. Beautiful, talented, electric in front of a camera. And yet, for decades, public commentary has pertained mostly to her tragic - and confusing - death. How did a woman terrified of dark water die at sea? Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Celebs who moonlight as trolls | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Well hello there lovely people!!! On today’s show: The messiest social media breakup we’ve seen in, well, just about ever. Then, Ariana Grande gets married, our thoughts on that Craig McLachlan interview, and finally! The Chrissy Teigen bullying claims that are so bad, they could be career ending. This week, Zara recommended you listen to the episode of The Cut called ‘How Do I Know If I Want Kids’.

item.title: Kim's 72-day marriage: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO PALS! Welcome to part two of our Humpdashians series. Ten years ago, Kim Kardashian’s public profile went from reality TV stardom to total PR disaster. Yep, she was filing for divorce, just 21 days after her televised wedding extravaganza was watched by millions. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: You can't just... throw a shoe at someone | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey pals! Happy Thursday!!! On today’s show: Can we talk about why TikTok is desperate to expose Justin Bieber as an awful husband? Plus, another week, another Jen and Ben headline and CelebSpellcheck explains why they are back but not really back at all. Then, the story of Lea Michele throwing a shoe on the set of a mag shoot that sparked a conversation about what to do about stories of celebrities behaving badly.

item.title: Kim's 72-day marriage: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Mondaaaay everyone! Today, we’re heading back to 2010, when Kim Kardashian was just starting to make a name for herself around the world. She didn’t know it then, but when she met a basketballer by the name of Kris Humphries, their stars combining would soon become one of the juiciest headlines of the decade. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: “I’d rather die but thank you anyway" | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning favourite people! On today’s show: Victoria Beckham would, and we quote, “rather die” than wear some of Justin Bieber’s new Crocs and honestly, same. Plus, the fall and rise of an Aussie fitness queen, Kate and Will’s PR team takes the approach of “more is better”, and that Billie Eilish Vogue cover - how the teen pop star is turning just about everything on its head.

item.title: The slut-shaming of Lara Bingle: Part two | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, mates! Welcome to part two of our Lara Bingle series. Today’s episode is covering 2010 to now, beginning with the March morning when a naked photo of Lara landed on the cover of Woman’s Day. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Big thanks to the team over at Scratch Pet Foods for making this episode possible.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: It Ends With Us | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6eKjWrE1urOLi4MmdMT5dW?si=433b4ecad25f45d7 Hiya! Happy Saturday! This month, we tucked into the heart-shattering 2016 novel, It Ends With Us by Colleen Hoover. It Ends With Us tells the story of an unusual love triangle between protagonist Lily, her first high school romance Atlas, and neurosurgeon Ryle. It’s a page-turning bestseller that explores the dynamics of physically abusive relationships, and how the cycle of violence needs to be broken despite the crushing heartbreak that inevitably flows.

item.title: Why are we so fascinated with 'botched' faces? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Wassup friends!!! On today’s show: Lizzo slides right into the DMs of Chris Evans and won’t stop sharing the screenshots with her followers. Plus, Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker go from sucking each other’s thumbs to straddling in the desert and we have just a couple of questions. And then! The perfect influencer couple whose perfect life wasn’t actually all that perfect, and the photo of Zac Efron that has sparked many-a-plastic surgery conversations.

item.title: The slut-shaming of Lara Bingle: Part one | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, friends! Today we’re paying 2006 a visit. That’s when teenage model Lara Bingle spent three weeks with married football star Brendan Fevola. Their handful of meetings would send her career, her reputation, and her life careening down a tumultuous new path. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Whip out your breakup murals | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday fabulous people! On today’s show: J-Lo and A-Rod’s heartbreak looks very different after announcing their split. Plus, Cody Simpson wants to boost the profile of… swimming… globally, we have some questions about SAS’s new lineup, and last but not least: how a prank about fairy bread exposed the biases of Australia’s biggest media publications. This week, Mich defaulted her recommendation to Producer Annabelle, who recommended watching the movie Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom on Netflix.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tarang Chawla | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Gah, it’s our last In Conversation episode for a little while!!! And what a show we have for you today. Tarang Chawla is an Indian-born Australian lawyer, writer and anti-family violence advocate. In 2015, Tarang’s younger sister Nikita was murdered by her then-husband at the age of just 23. In the years since, Tarang has become one of the country’s leading campaigners for gender equality and advocates for women and children’s safety from family violence.

item.title: Will you be my Byron bae? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Gooooood morning all! On today’s show: What do we make of the rumour that Blake Lively and Anna Kendrick… kind of hated each other? The Aussie influencer who’s the first person to be officially slapped on the wrist by an advertising standards board, Taylor Swift’s fresh album brings about fresh questions on her past, and - last but not least - the Byron Baes: Netflix has snapped up a reality show about Australia’s celebrity capital.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Mari Andrew | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A very happy Monday to you, Shameless frens! Today on the show, we bring you the incredibly warm Mari Andrew. If you don’t recognise Mari’s name, which you likely do anyway, you’ll no doubt know and adore the illustrations she posts on her Instagram account @bymariandrew. In 2015 after her father passed away, Mari began posting a watercoloured illustration a day onto her Instagram page, as a way to express grief, yes, but to also spread light.

item.title: A black market bikini photo | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday legends!!! On today’s show: The unapproved photo of Khloe Kardashian that was swiftly removed from every corner of the internet this week, Australia loses a fashion icon in Carla Zampatti, YouTuber James Charles finds himself in yet another scandal, and then! Australian media personality and influencer Abbie Chatfield jumps on the hottest trend in health and wellness right now: sex toys. This week, Zara recommended Claire Christian’s book, It’s Been a Pleasure, Noni Blake.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Yumiko Kadota | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Gooooood morning, wonderful listeners! Today on the show, we bring you the brave Yumiko Kadota. Yumiko, as you’d read in her new memoir Emotional Female, has been an over-achiever her entire life, studying medicine at university and deciding to enter the perilous surgical stream when specialising as a doctor. Only, it was when Yumiko found herself trying to become a surgeon that she encountered the true, brutal nature of Australia’s hospital culture.

item.title: Slip on your Satan sneakers! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey pals! On today’s show: What the hell - literally - is going on with Lil Nas X right now, and why is he courting so much controversy this week? Then, why influencer’s mirror selfies are a big fat lie, Married At First Sight sparks important conversations about abusive relationships, and how one of Australia’s most iconic fashion brands, The Daily Edited, found itself in a bit of a PR debacle this week.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Joel Creasey | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya! Happy Monday! Today on the show, we bring you the effervescent Joel Creasey. Joel is best known as one of the country’s leading stand-up comedians, having begun performing at the age of just 16. He’s performed everywhere from the Melbourne International Comedy Festival to the New York International Fringe Festival and the Edinburgh Fringe. But beyond comedy, Joel is also an author, an actor, and TV presenter who, after a stint on I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here, became one of our most recognisable faces on television.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: The Shadow Box | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/7DE63ZzOef240bv3X3sJjj?si=1e64f004df3e4948 Halloooooo, fellow book clubbers! This month, we are looking at best-selling author Luanne Rice’s pacey thriller, The Shadow Box. This book jumps before and after the day artist Claire Chase was brutally attacked, to explain just what happened to her. Claire survives before going into hiding and has her suspicions on who her attacker likely was - her admired husband and state attorney, Griffin Chase, who is also running for governor.

item.title: So, we'll never be billionaires? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello, lovely people! On today’s show: What does a billionaire like Kylie Jenner owe the people around her? Plus, Orlando Bloom is getting roasted online for his morning routine, Celeb Spell Check all but disappears from Instagram, the Hembrows are getting a reality show and then!!! Demi Lovato bares so much of her trauma - including what led to her 2018 overdose - for a new documentary. This week, Zara recommended listening to the interview with Will McMahon on The Imperfects.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Chantelle Otten | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLOOO EVERYONE! Today on the show, we bring you the serene Chantelle Otten. Chantelle is best known as one of the countries leading psycho-sexologists who works out of Melbourne with a team of more than 20. To put it simply, Chantelle is the authority on sex, not just for Australian women, but for Australians from all walks of life. She has built an incredibly successful career being one of the leading voices shattering taboos around sex: about what the average sex life should look like, about how common painful sex is, and about how sex can be pleasurable, no matter what body you live in.

item.title: The influencer circle of life | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh haaaiiii! Happy Thursday! On today’s show: Bec Judd’s op shop donation causes an influencer storm, J-Lo’s engagement is on, then off, then on again, and the slut-shaming of Melbourne socialite Mia Fevola. Finally - last but not least - a chat about the Grammys and what the performance line-up told us about the legacy of music’s bad boy, John Mayer. This week, Zara got a Kindle and hates it!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Priyanka Chopra Jonas | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description GOOD MORNING LISTENER FRIENDS!!!! Today on the show, we bring you the most famous person we’ve ever had the privilege of interviewing on this podcast, Priyanka Chopra Jonas. Priyanka has more than 60 million followers on Instagram, is one of the biggest Bollywood actors and producers of her generation, has managed to pull off a seamless transition into Hollywood, is married to a Jonas brother, and just published a New York Times best-selling memoir.

item.title: A *royally* bad IWD cover | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning lovely people! On today’s show: Stellar Magazine posted a bunch of topless men on their cover to celebrate IWD we have a few questions, Dolce and Gabbana sues Diet Prada for a stupid amount of money, the next Bachelor is announced as a past Bachelorette gets married, and then! OF COURSE, Meghan, Harry, Oprah, and that history-making interview. This week, Zara recommended Honeybee and the Instagram account, MipsChips.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Grace Tame | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning wonderful Shameless community. Today on the show, we bring you the absolute force that is Grace Tame. When Grace was just 15 years old, she was repeatedly groomed and raped by a 58-year-old maths teacher who taught at her Tasmanian high school. While - after serving his jail sentence - her perpetrator was allowed to speak about his crimes with the media, Grace legally wasn’t: she was prevented by law from sharing her story with the world.

item.title: Even celebs have shitty boyfriends | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo! Happy Thursday!!!! On today’s show: Taylor Swift blasts Netflix to her 88 million followers, Hilaria and Alec Baldwin’s big baby mystery, the Married at First Sight “hotness ranking” challenge that made the reality show’s “experts” look more like evil masterminds, and life through the eyes of Billie Eilish - how the teen star’s rise to the top has been very different to those who have gone before her.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Celeste Barber | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Mondaaaaay everybody! Today on the show, we bring you the remarkable Celeste Barber. We have no doubt you know precisely who Celeste is - she does have 10 million followers across Instagram and Facebook - but we’ll introduce her to you anyway. Celeste began her career as an actress, but over the last six years, has channeled her talent for making people think and laugh into a movement she calls ‘Challenge Accepted’.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Just Like You | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/7aYSmwZekgTofjWGy1LGX3?si=7c50e5683df149c5 G’day book club friends!!! This month, we read best-selling author Nick Hornby’s eighth novel, Just Like You. The book follows two protagonists, 22-year-old Joseph and 42-year-old Lucy, who fall in love despite coming from two different worlds. Joseph is a young Black DJ trying to find his place in the world, while Lucy is a white English teacher and mum of two, who has recently separated from her addict ex-husband.

item.title: The golden boy loses his shine | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Heeeeey mates! On today’s show: Kimye have finally filed their divorce papers and the betting markets have gone wild on who Kim is going to date next. Plus, why Emma Watson may have just retired from acting, Gwyneth Paltrow thinks she was the first person to wear a mask, and then, the fall of NRL great Sam Burgess and what it says about our obsession with sporting stars.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bridget Malcolm | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Helloooooo pals! Today on the show, we bring you the brilliant Bridget Malcolm. Bridget is a classically-trained musician, best known as an international model who walked for Victoria’s Secret in their 2015 and 2016 fashion shows, as well as walking for brands like Ralph Lauren and Stella McCartney. But Bridget’s story in the fashion industry isn’t just one of glitzy catwalks and endless travel. Instead, Bridget spent much of her early and prominent years modelling battling a relentless eating disorder which, for two years, saw her live off little more than protein shakes and steamed vegetables.

item.title: Prying paps and tricky tabloids | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday legends!!! On today’s show: Scott Disick is dating… yep, another teenager. Then, Justin Timberlake’s apology, an Aussie magazine’s huge Meghan and Harry blunder, and finally, a big bumper discussion about the Bondi paparazzi: How Aussie tabloids and their seedy photographers are slowly - and insidiously - influencing the way you think about women in the public eye. This week, Mich recommended checking out your nearest plant delivery service, and Zara recommended watching the movie Holding The Man, which you can find on Netflix or Stan.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Martha Kalifatidis | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday folks! Today on the show, we bring you the vibrant Martha Kalifatidis. You’re likely familiar with the makeup artist and reality star after she appeared in one of the country’s most-watched seasons of Married at First Sight. Yes, she may well be known for a certain wine throwing incident, but she also left the show with a huge and fiercely loyal group of fans who fell in love with how confident, unapologetic, and yes - if we may use a buzzword to round this list out - authentic she really is.

item.title: Archiving > deleting | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO, LOVELY LISTENERS! On today’s show: Australia has its own local and modern-day gossip girl - Celeb Spellcheck - so what happens when influencers are determined to track her down and expose her identity? Plus, Kim Kardashian West thinks her seven-year-old daughter North is Picasso, why the Golden Globes are more irrelevant than ever, and then, why Janet Jackson was trending on Monday, some 17 years after the term ‘nipplegate’ entered the zeitgeist.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Yassmin Abdel-Magied | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEY FRIENDS! Today on the show, we bring you the whip-smart Yassmin Abdel-Magied. Yassmin is a media personality and a writer, yes, but she’s also a woman who worked for years as a successful engineer and social justice advocate who, at just 16, started the youth charity Youth Without Borders. In 2010 she was named Young Queenslander of the year, and in 2015, she was named Queensland Australian of the Year.

item.title: Is it OK to ask about Dua Lipa’s looks? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Why hello there, lovely people! On today’s show: Jennifer Coolidge is suddenly absolutely everywhere, a lil’ collection of stories from the week that prove some male celebs are truly the worst, Adele’s divorce settlement has a sneaky catch, and then! The question from a Rolling Stone profile that had Dua Lipa stewing for days. This week, Mich and Zara both recommend you watch It’s a Sin on Stan.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bonny Rebecca | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HIYA FRIENDS! Today on the show, we bring you the ever-so-sweet Bonny Rebecca. For the unacquainted, Bonny Rebecca is a content creator and influencer with one hell of a story to tell. In 2018, at the height of the plant-based Instagram movement, Bonny - someone who had built a life and a career based on the lifestyle - decided to tell the world that she was leaving veganism for good.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Daisy Jones & The Six | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1P6d02a7tL2b9rZsYNO7aw?si=0670cc460f2546cf Happy Saturday book club pals! This month, we tore through Daisy Jones & The Six - the sixth novel from bestselling author Taylor Jenkins Reid that looks at the whirlwind rise of a fictional, iconic 1970s rock group and their beautiful lead singer, revealing the mystery behind their infamous breakup. Today on the show, Mich, Zara, and Annabelle talk about the love-hate relationship between Daisy and Billy, the book’s interview format, and what the story said about love, monogamy, drugs, loneliness, and fame.

item.title: Wanting your cake and eating it too | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO! HAPPY THURSDAY! On today’s show: An Aussie fashion designer’s Instagram posts about Invasion Day leave everyone confused, raising questions about performative activism online. Plus! Ben Affleck and Ana De Armas’s bizarre breakup, the latest on Harry Styles’s relationship with Olivia Wilde, and finally, a deep dive on the worldwide sensation that is Jojo Siwa, who came out as a member of the LGBTIQ+ community this week. This week, Mich recommended the You’re Wrong About podcast episode, ‘The Obesity Epidemic’.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Style by Deni | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A very happy Monday to you, wonderful friends! Today on the show, we bring you the electric Deni Todorovic. You may well know Deni by their moniker, Style by Deni - a nod to their successful career as a fashion editor at Cosmopolitan Magazine and now GT magazine, and work as a celebrity stylist. In this chat, we go everywhere: from the moment as a kid they knew they were different, to working in the magazine industry as it was slowly dying, to coming to grips with their own gender identity.

item.title: Drivers licenses and 'the Baldwinitos' | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO! MAN OH MAN ARE WE HAPPY TO BE BACK! And HELLOOOO to Thursday, you fresh, sexy day! So glad we could make it! What a delight! What a time! What a year! On today’s show: A big ‘ol recap of the stories that dominated this summer and boy do we have a show for you. From Hilaria Baldwin’s Spanish controversy, to Armie Hammer’s deer heart ways, and Olivia Rodrigo’s viral chart-topping song - we’re covering every story we missed over the break.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tayla Damir | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description We’re baaaaaack and BOY is this a goodie to officially kick off 2021! Today on the show, we bring you the delightful Tayla Damir. You may know Tayla from her time on Love Island season one where she fell in love, won the reality show, and promptly found out her boyfriend - the one she won beside - actually had a girlfriend on the outside the entire time. Now, with an Instagram following of more than half a million people, Tayla Damir has proven to be so much more than her Island experience and the drama that ensued in the weeks after.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Alyce Tran | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya friends! Today on the show, we bring you the powerhouse that is Alyce Tran. For the unacquainted, Alyce is an entrepreneur to be reckoned with. She is the brains behind The Daily Edited, an accessories label that makes personalised, monogrammed clutches, phone cases, and luggage - the must-have pieces of the moment. In this chat, we talk about the glamour of running your own empire, but also the grit and the ugly parts, too.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Allira Potter | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo friends! Today on the show, we bring you the glorious Allira Potter. Allira has curated an incredible career by being herself and embracing what the universe throws at her. Despite having numerous hurdles in her path since her mother’s death when she was a teenager, Allira has flourished and thrived. Allira is a body positive warrior who helps her audience practice self-love every single day. In this chat, we talk with Allira about processing grief after her mother’s passing, how spirituality completely changed her perspective, and finding new love.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Samantha Wills | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Goooood morning, everyone! HAPPY LAST DAY OF 2020! Today on the show, we bring you the formidable Samantha Wills. You likely know Samantha’s name from her eponymous jewelry line, Samantha Wills. Back in 2004, Sam decided to invest her last $500 to showcase her jewelry - jewelry she was then selling at the Bondi markets at Australian Fashion Week. People fell in love, and very soon, she was overwhelmed with orders.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Transcendent Kingdom | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/0D39Y5QgX53l9PngQlT7AS?si=239a0943f6854fef OHHH, it’s the last book club for 2020, friends! This month, we read Transcendent Kingdom by Yaa Gyasi - a novel that centres around Gifty, a neuroscientist at Stanford who studies addiction and depression neural circuits through experimenting with mice. This, we come to learn, is no coincidence. Transcendent Kingdom deals with grief, mental illness, and religion, and also takes us back through Gifty’s life: From her brother’s opioid addiction to a disappearing father to being sent to Ghana to live with her Aunt while her mother battles depression at home.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: You guys! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description MERRY CHRISTMAS EVE, FAVOURITE PEOPLE! Today, we bring you a very special episode with you guys, the Shameless community! We think there’s no better time to reminisce on the year that was, all while hearing your thoughts on everything from your favourite pop culture stories of 2020, to which Shameless interviews have stayed with you the most, and what lessons you’ll be taking into 2021. We will be back with normal programming on January 18!

item.title: Off with your head, 2020 | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLOOOO AND MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL! On today’s show: Exactly what’s gone down between The Slumflower and Florence Given, Cody Simpson randomly pops up in Australian Olympic trials, a definitive ranking of all of the best and worst Christmas songs of all time, and a wrap on the year that was. What has 2020 taught us about ourselves and the world? This week, Zara recommended Zoe Foster Blake’s dinner playlist on Spotify and Mich recommended watching Geordie Shore (lol).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nazeem Hussain | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday friends! Today on the show, we bring you the hilarious Nazeem Hussain. Nazeem is a comedian, actor and TV personality who has performed stand-up at comedy festivals all around the world. Nazeem created and starred in the SBS show ‘Legally Brown’, the sketch comedy series ‘Orange Is The New Brown’ on Channel 7, and has his very own, critically-acclaimed Netflix Special called ‘Nazeem Hussain: Public Frenemy’.

item.title: Two words: coconut oil | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday wonderful people! On today’s show: The influencer s*x tape that’s made us see coconut oil in an entirely new light. Plus, Johnny Depp’s celeb-laden love life is outed as part of his court case against Amber Heard, Taylor Swift outdoes herself by releasing her second album in 2020, and - last but not least- the Red Table Talk that sparked a huge discussion about star power and privilege.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Kylie Brown | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey, legends! Today on the show, we bring you the formidable Kylie Brown. Kylie is in the public eye, partly, because her husband Jonathan Brown is a well-known former AFL star and radio personality. But it’s what Kylie has managed to do with her profile and platform that has blown us away. After struggling with chronic endometriosis for two decades, and undergoing no less than nine surgeries - including a hysterectomy at 34 - to manage her condition, Kylie opened an Instagram account to track her journey and spread awareness about endo.

item.title: Where art thou manly men? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day friends! On today’s show: What your Spotify Wrapped says about you, plus, Juno star Elliot Page announces he is transgender, Rhianna has a very famous new bf, and why conservatives lost their flippin’ minds over Harry Styles wearing a dress in Vogue. This week, Mich recommended The Story of Diana on Netflix, and Zara recommended reading Cazzie David’s piece, ‘Ex Dysmorphia’, in Air Mail. Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Oaty Bruce.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rupi Kaur | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday everyone! Today on the show, we bring you the inimitable Rupi Kaur. Rupi is the writer and poet of three best-selling books: Milk and Honey, The Sun and her Flowers, and Home Body, which have sold a cumulative 8 million copies worldwide and been translated into 42 languages. In 2017, Kaur was named in BBC’s 100 Women list, and in 2019, The New Republic named her the writer of the decade.

item.title: Diana's millennial makeover | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday lovely people! On today’s show: Do not call Justin Bieber a pop star, the bizarre backlash to Meghan Markle’s New York Times essay, and then, has Zac Efron put an end to his ‘hot normie’ relationship? Finally, we talk all about the millennial makeover of Princess Diana. This week, Zara recommended listening to the You’re Wrong About podcast. Michelle recommended keeping an eye out for our Shameless 12 Days of Giveaways, dropping into your Instagram feeds TOMORROW!

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Ghosts | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/5PwGumOnjhUbz2vNtWkQdS?si=90750de4c18e40ec A very happy Saturday to you, book club friends!!! This month, we’re delving into bestselling author Dolly Alderton’s fiction debut: the warm, funny, tender novel, Ghosts. Ghosts tells the story of food writer Nina Dean who enters her thirties with a successful career under her belt and strong friendships around her. And then, well… then she meets Max - a tall, clever, evasive man who told her on their first date that he will marry her.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: The Inspired Unemployed | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HIYA FRIENDS! Today, we bring you the men behind The Inspired Unemployed, Matt Ford and Jack Steele. Matt and Jack have gone from relative obscurity to being an internationally-recognised duo in only the last year or so. They have accumulated 600,000 followers on TikTok and nearly 800,000 on Instagram, and have also fronted campaigns for Fendi, The Iconic, and Louis Vuitton. In this chat, we talk about the transition from working on suburban job sites as tradies to starring on the cover of GQ, as well as how they keep having fun when their side hustle has now become their full-time job.

item.title: Catch ya never, Pete | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEY FRIENDS! On today’s show: Nigella Lawson’s buttered toast technique becomes a very British scandal. Plus, Angie Kent rightly disparages cover story clickbait, and then, is this the end of Pete Evans as we know him? This week, Zara recommended reading our November book club pick, Ghosts by Dolly Alderton. Mich recommended this Vodka pasta recipe from Gigi Hadid. Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Calming Blankets. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for $115 off any adult weighted blanket.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Florence Given | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday everybody!!! Today, we bring you the enigmatic Florence Given. For the unacquainted, Florence is nothing short of a force to be reckoned with. The 21-year-old feminist illustrator, writer, and activist released her debut book, Women Don’t Owe You Pretty, in June this year, and has gone on to become a number one Sunday Times bestseller. Florence now has a social media following of more than half a million people, and has single-handedly carved out one of the most engaged spaces for the queer community online.

item.title: The fall of a 'hypepriest' | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya friends! On today’s show: The most brutal riches to rags story that we’ve read in a very long time. Plus, the future of shoppable shows like Euphoria, an internal crisis on why we give so many effs about the love lives of teenage Tik Tokkers, and the Hillsong “hypepriest” who ruined his career with an extra-marital affair. This week, Zara recommended The Rise Of The Murdoch Dynasty on ABC iView.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nakkiah Lui | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Why hello there! Today, we bring you the very warm Nakkiah Lui. Nakkiah is a Gamilaroi and Torres Strait Islander woman who writes for both the theatre and television. Nakkiah has co-written and starred in the ABC’s Black Comedy, created and starred in Kiki and Kitty for the ABC, co-hosted the Buzzfeed podcast series Pretty for an Aboriginal, and in 2019, released her debut novel, Black Is The New White.

item.title: Three days. THREE. DAYS. | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO LISTENER FRIENDS! On today’s show: The explosive Bachelorette finale that took us by surprise after quite a lacklustre season. Plus, the baby rumours that Hailey Bieber is having none of, and then, how one of Netflix’s most-streamed films in 2020 also happens to be one of the worst Christmas movies we’ve ever seen. This week, Mich and Zara recommended some top-quality/kinda niche Christmas movies you should spend your time watching instead of Holidate - While You Were Sleeping and Home Alone Four.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sophie Delezio | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiiiii lovely people! Today, we bring you the remarkable Sophie Delezio. If Sophie’s name sounds familiar, you were probably first introduced to her story more than 16 years ago, when a car crashed into Sophie’s daycare centre and trapped Sophie underneath. In that incident, she suffered burns to more than 85% of her body, lost both of her feet, a number of fingers, and an ear. A few years later, Sophie’s life was threatened again by a serious car accident, where, after being thrown from her wheelchair, she obtained an acquired brain injury.

item.title: The great birthday party divide | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey there! On today’s show: Is James Corden the next to fall down to cancel culture? Plus, the celebrity baby boom, David Beckham’s massive Netflix’s deal, and the Kardashian birthday story that split Shameless listeners right down the middle. Is it a bit gross to celebrate your 40th birthday on a private island and post about it on social media, all in the midst of a pandemic? Or, should we just accept that rich people are going to live their very best lives, no matter what the rest of us are doing?

item.title: BOOK CLUB: A Man Called Ove | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/600Rgh3RDus8kKPuHsfQwF?si=b78c69ef8eef4e7b HEY THERE BOOK CLUB FRIENDS! This month, we’re talking all about the critically acclaimed, worldwide bestseller from Swedish columnist and blogger Fredrik Backman - A Man Called Ove. Ove is the kind of man who points at people he dislikes as if they were burglars caught outside his bedroom window. He has staunch principles, strict routines, and a short fuse.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Andy Lee | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday friends! If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!

item.title: Oystergate | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday lovely people! On today’s show: The influencer who reportedly held up a Jetstar flight because she was busy shucking oysters, an examination of Blake Lively’s very confusing shoes, and then, a discussion on that scene in the new Borat movie. Finally, we do a deep dive on the most talked-about story of the week: Bec Judd’s now-infamous ‘Free Melbourne’ t-shirt. This week, Zara recommended the movie ‘Brexit: The Uncivil War’ on Stan.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: AJ Clementine | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Thursday friends! Today, we bring you the wonderful AJ Clementine. AJ is an influencer and content creator, well known for her LGBTQI advocacy, sense of style, and bright personality. AJ knew from the youngest of ages that she wasn’t born in the right body and began medically transitioning at the age of 18. Now 24, she is the first transgender person to model for a Bonds campaign, has walked the runway at VAMFF, and cemented herself as a leading voice for young Australians with over 100,000 followers on Instagram.

item.title: The (most meta) affair | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo wonderful people! On today’s show: The Dominic West and Lily James affair we never could have predicted but care so very much about. Plus, Cardi B and Offset are back together AGAIN, Billie Eilish is trolled for having… a body… and then, why everyone cannot stop talking about Netflix’s, Emily In Paris. This week, Zara recommended The Comey Rule on Stan. She also recommended mixing up your washing powder!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Dolly Alderton | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, Shameless pals! Today, we bring you the electric Dolly Alderton. Dolly is a British columnist, author and podcaster, best known as the co-host of the widely popular current affairs podcast, The High Low. She is also the author of the bestselling memoir, Everything I Know About Love, but is now trying her hand at fiction, on the cusp of releasing her very first novel, Ghosts. In this chat, Dolly explains what it’s like to have half a million people know about her life - both the good parts and the ugly - in her twenties, and why she’s so determined to protect her private life in her thirties.

item.title: The one where The Daily Mail breaks us | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY FRIENDS!!! On today’s show: The Fleetwood Mac and cranberry juice TikTok that has exploded online. Then, The Bachelorette’s relevancy problem and what to make of the rumours that Naya Rivera’s ex-husband and sister have become romantically linked in the wake of her death. And finally, two Daily Mail stories were published on the weekend that epitomise absolutely everything grotesquely wrong with the publication. This week, Zara recommended listening to our upcoming In Conversation episode with (incoming clickbait!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Cole Brown | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Why hello there, listener friends! Today, we bring you the very clever Cole Brown. Cole is a twenty-five-year-old author and writer who has just published his first critically acclaimed book, Greyboy. It’s a series of essays written about life at the intersection of class and race, where in it, Cole shares so many valuable personal insights on white privilege, racism, and black identity.
