In this chat, Cole talks about what it’s like growing up black in America when you don’t quite fit the stereotype of what the world tells you being black looks like.

item.title: Waiting for rain | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday pals! On today’s show: What is ‘Surge Capacity’ and why are people like Brené Brown talking so much about it? Plus, Kylie Jenner dresses daughter Stormi in a $16,000 backpack. And then, Chrissy Teigen and John Legend’s harrowing loss. Just a warning before listening to this episode: Our final segment discusses pregnancy loss and bereavement, and may be triggering for some listeners. If you need, reach out for support from SANDS here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bella Varelis | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, Shameless fam! Today, we bring you the lovely Bella Varelis. Whether you’re a fan of The Bachelor franchise or not, you’ll likely know Bella’s name after its finale aired last Thursday, when Locky told Bella and this season’s winner, Irena, that he loved them both. In this chat, we ask Bella about it all: From what compelled her to apply for The Bachelor, to the friendships she made and lost on the show, and the relentless online abuse she’s been receiving these past few months.

item.title: I love you (but let's break up) | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEY FRIENDS! On today’s show: TikTok is creating superstars overnight - but at what cost? Plus, The Bachelor finale that had the most controversial finale since The Honey Badger chose no-one, and then, Sir David Attenborough joins Instagram and the world loses its shit. This week, Zara recommended the podcast episode by The Cut called ‘Rich People Problems’. Mich recommended watching The Social Dilemma on Netflix. To those VIP Shameless listeners who stayed til the end of this ep!

item.title: BOOK CLUB: A Lonely Girl is a Dangerous Thing | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/34sAPyThLPFoNb0KrINOit?si=534aa77cd2c74d0a Hiiiiya pals! This month, we’re talking all about Jessie Tu’s debut novel, A Lonely Girl Is A Dangerous Thing. It’s a novel about a young Taiwanese-Australian woman named Jena Lin, who - after being recognised as a prodigy throughout childhood - has re-introduced classical violin back into her life as a 20-something Syndey-sider. We see Jena navigate relationships of all kinds in this book, and how those relationships affect the way she views and treats herself.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Hamish Blake | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO FRIENDS! Today, we are joined by the incredible Hamish Blake - a comedian, writer, and one half of Australia’s most iconic radio and podcasting duos, Hamish and Andy. Hamish is Australia’s funniest person, yes, but he is so much more than that, too. Behind the scenes, he is such a supportive and kind person in the industry who is very generous with his time, a switched on business person, and, of course, a father of two.

item.title: You! Don't! Need! To! Like! The! Photo! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Greetings, good people! Happy Monday! On today’s show: We have some issues with the Instagram activity of this year’s bachelor, Locky Gilbert. Plus, how do we feel about J.K. Rowling’s books being removed from bookstore shelves in the wake of her transphobic statements? Then, a deep dive on model Emily Ratajkowski’s viral essay in New York Magazine’s The Cut this week, and an exploration of women’s bodies, the photographs of those bodies, and who actually owns them.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jennifer Atilemile | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday lovely people! Today on the show we have the formidable Jennifer Atilemile. Jennifer is an international model and writer who advocates for greater representation of racial and body diversity in the media, and who has very recently landed one of the biggest jobs of her career: A campaign with Victoria’s Secret. In this chat we cover everything from what she loves about the modelling industry, to why she feels every job she books is - in her own words - “a win for not just size diversity, but a win for the increase in racial and body diversity in advertising, too.

item.title: Zac Efron’s 'hot normie’ girlfriend | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A happy, happy Monday to you all! On today’s show: Zac Efron has a new Aussie girlfriend, and we’re sorry, but it’s not you. Plus, why the hell is Wayne Carey one of the country’s biggest faces on TV, and then, what does the cancellation of Keeping Up With The Kardashians say about the changing nature of celebrity? This week, Mich recommended Concrete Jellyfish earrings, and Zara recommended Little Fires Everywhere on Amazon Prime.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Zara McDonald | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day, wonderful humans! Last week, Zara interviewed Mich to celebrate the launch of their new book, The Space Between. Well, this week it’s Zara’s turn to be interviewed! Yay! Fun! Ok Less me (Annabelle, hey!) now, more them! In this chat, Mich asks Zara about it all: From how it feels to find out both your parents are sick with cancer, to having fears of infertility, working through chronic illness, and breaking down the self-doubt that often arises when you’re in a job as public and personal as this one.

item.title: ATTN: Khloé Kardashian | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HALLOOOOO, WONDERFUL PEOPLE! On today’s show: Khloé Kardashian and Tristan Thompson are officially back together for the third time, and do we have any right to massively roll our eyes at that fact? Then, singer Adele runs - hair first - into a sea of controversy, and finally, how many friends do you need to be happy, and in 2020 is it possible to be best mates with someone whose world view differs so greatly from your own?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Michelle Andrews | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! Surprise! It’s Mich! In conversation! You guys have been asking for us to interview each other for quite a while now and we figured there was no better opportunity to do exactly that than the two eps following our book launch. In this chat, Zara asks Mich about the experience of her parents separating when she was in her early twenties, how she finds fulfilment in her work, and her final essay in The Space Between, where she generously shares a chapter of her life story that she’s never told the world before.

item.title: Beware the swarm of stans | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi everybody!!!! On today’s show: How does Stan culture function in 2020, and why do so many celebrities struggle with valid critique? Then, Pete Evans and Magda Szubanski lock heads on celebrity-led COVID ads, and finally, we remember Chadwick Boseman - a star gone too soon who left an indelible mark on the world. This week, Zara recommended this Caramilk pudding recipe. Mich recommended watching Suits if you haven’t already, which you can find on Netflix here.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: The Yield | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1uqMITiWOWN4yR5Uz5ierO?si=043dae8ac94c478b Correction: An earlier edit of this episode said the fictional town of Massacre Plains was based in the Northern Territory of Australia. This is incorrect - the town is based in New South Wales. HELLOOOOO BOOK CLUB PALS! This month, we’re discussing the 2020 Miles Franklin Literary Award winner, The Yield, by Tara June Winch. The novel tells the story of a woman who has returned home after the passing of her Poppy, Albert Gondiwindi, and felt like her life had passed her by ever since her sister, Jedda, vanished as a child.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jessica Nguyen | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEY HEY! Happy Thursday! Today on the show, we bring you our good friend and resident foodie, Jess Nguyen. Jess is a home cook and recipe creator who, after being made redundant from her job at Mecca in March this year, made herself the go-to source of delicious, easy-to-cook meals. It’s not even been six months since her redundancy, and Jess has already worked with brands like Vogue Australia to bring joy to her rapidly growing Instagram following of almost fifty thousand people.

item.title: Two women, thirteen years, a new narrative | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday morning, absolute faves! On today’s show: Does former Bachelorette Georgia Love have a right to complain about her wedding being cancelled for the second time? Plus, The Masked Singer Australia has been shutdown after seven crew members tested positive for COVID-19, and how do we feel about television shows being considered ’essential services’. Then, actress Olympia Valance had her intimate photos hacked from her phone and shared illegally online and the media coverage could not be more different compared to the headlines surrounding Vanessa Hudgens’ photo leaks 13 years ago.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jameela Jamil | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description IT’S A VERY HAPPY THURSDAY INDEED!!!!! Today on the show, we bring the incredible Jameela Jamil (a woman who probably doesn’t need an introduction, but of course, we’ll give her one anyway). Jameela is a British actress, former radio host, writer, and activist who rose to global fame through her role as Tahani Al-Jamil on The Good Place. She is also the brainchild behind the I Weigh movement - a force of more than one million people who band together to challenge dangerous diet culture on platforms like Instagram.

item.title: The hair rant that stopped the nation | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HI! HELLO! HOW ARE YA??! On today’s show: The influencer who broke lockdown laws and was taken down by social media vigilantism. Then, is Rihanna planning total world domination? And finally, we go deep on the Bachelor season premiere and that red hair rant. This week, Zara recommended the Bloody Floradora cocktail. Mich recommended another thing you can digest! This green shakshuka by Shameless Media’s resident head chef, Jess Nguyen.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Alisha Aitken-Radburn | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY THURSDAY EVERYBODY!!! Today on the show, we bring you very candid, very clever, Alisha Aitken-Radburn. Alisha is something of Bachelor royalty after appearing on the Honey Badger’s season in 2018, and then on two consecutive seasons of Bachelor in Paradise. In this chat, we cover Alisha’s career in politics and her time in the Bachelor mansion. And then, Alisha talks for the first time about those cheating rumours surrounding her relationship with Glenn.

item.title: Pour holy water into our ears!!! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day glorious people! On today’s show: The music video for the new single ‘WAP’ by Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion is here and it’s SO damn saucy it broke the internet. Plus, what Bachelor in Paradise’s Ciarran and Timm tell us about male possessiveness over women. And then, the anti-wrinkle, anti-aging, totally baffling vagina masks that one Aussie model wants you to buy. This week, Zara recommended the episode of The Daily, The Day That Shook Beirut.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: G Flip | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLOOOOO FRIEND! Today on the show, we bring you the absolutely energising G Flip. G is a drummer-turned-solo-artist, singer songwriter, and music producer, who after uploading her single ‘About You’ to Triple J Unearthed in February 2018, has since become a star. G has performed at music festivals like Splendour in the Grass and One Night Stand to her thousands of fans, and released her debut studio album in August last year.

item.title: Sister Bachelorettes and #ChallengeAccepted | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HOWDY FRIENDS! On today’s show: We have - not one - but TWO bachelorettes this year, and the country is quite divided over the news. Plus, the controversy around the #womensupportingwomen challenge on Instagram, and then, did Karlie Kloss and Taylor Swift date? We break down the dating rumour that just won’t go away. This week, Zara recommended listening to The Sunday Read from The Daily, in particular, their episode, ‘The Accusation’.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Red, White & Royal Blue | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/0j1QjxKHf3s5XKoiM8yzfF?si=2fb93456f13e45fd A very happy Saturday to you, Shameless book clubbers! This month, we’re talking all about Casey McQuiston’s debut, multiple award-winning novel, ‘Red, White & Royal Blue’. McQuiston’s book centres on Alex Claremont Diaz, the son of the first Female President of the United States. The story follows Alex and his love-hate relationship with a British Prince called Henry, and how their love affair threatens to derail American and British relations.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rae Johnston | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday absolute faves! Today on the show, we bring you the effervescent Rae Johnston. Rae is a Wiradjuri woman who fell pregnant as a teenager, and credits that experience with changing the course of her life. Rae is the former editor of millennial website Junkee, is an award-winning STEM journalist, and now holds the impressive role as the first ever Science and Technology Editor for NITV. In this chat, Rae tells us about what it’s like to miscarry as a teenager, fall pregnant again months later, then chase career dreams, all while raising a young child.

item.title: YoUnG pEoPlE nEeD hUgS | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh hiiiii there, wonderful humans! On today’s show: Do young people really lack resilience like Ita Buttrose said last week, and are they in need of more hugs? Plus, we need to talk about old mate Ziggy Alberts not being a fan of face masks. Then, we talk about Kanye West and the intersection of mental health and social media. This week, Mich recommended watching Monica Lewinsky’s TED Talk, The price of shame.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Julia Gillard | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HI HOW ARE YOU OK ENOUGH CHIT CHAT BECAUSE… Today on the show, we bring you the woman who needs no introduction - but we will attempt to give her one that does her justice - Julia Gillard. Julia was, of course, the first female Prime Minister of Australia, who is now the Chair of Beyond Blue, one of Australia’s leading mental health awareness bodies. Julia is also an avid advocate for addressing women’s under-representation in leadership, which was the motivation behind the book she just co-authored with Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, ‘Women and Leadership’.

item.title: Everything is cake | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A big good morning to you all, including our very special birthday gal, ZARA MCDONALD! On today’s show: What the fuck is going on with the “everything is cake” trend taking over twitter? Plus, we need to talk about the tragic death of Glee star Naya Rivera, and then, a discussion on the #FreeBritney movement that’s hit fever pitch. This week, Mich recommended going to a dog park (if you have a dog, of course) to brighten our fellow Melburnians’ lockdown days.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Pandora Sykes | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday everybodaaaayyy! Today on the show, we bring you the impressive Pandora Sykes. Pandora is a British journalist, columnist and broadcaster who was a former fashion editor at The Sunday Times Style and is now a contributing editor at ELLE. Of course, you probably know Pandora as the co-host of the very popular current affairs podcast, The High Low. In this chat, Pandora talks about her tight bond with co-host Dolly Alderton, as well as her upcoming collection of essays titled, ‘How Do We Know We Are Doing It Right?

item.title: Influencers are sleeping at the wheel | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday to our fave humans! On today’s show: The maaaany reasons Kanye West absolutely should not become President. Plus, the controversial Harper’s letter signed by scores of high-profile journalists and artists lamenting cancel culture, and then, a conversation about influencers, politics and a pandemic. This week, Mich recommended the Bumble and bumble thickening hairspray. Zara recommended watching Billions on Stan. Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, the Adore Beauty podcast, Beauty IQ Uncensored.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nas Campanella | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiiiiiii fantastic friends! Today on the show, we bring you the whip smart Nas Campanella. Nas is a journalist and the ABC’s first disability affairs reporter. She cut her teeth there and at Triple J, where she became one of the world’s first ever blind newsreaders. In this chat, Nas talks with us about the neurological condition that means she can’t read Braille, her career thus far, and the love she found in her personal life.

item.title: A king is dethroned | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning, lovely listeners! On today’s show: MICH ISSUES A RUSSELL CROWE-RELATED APOLOGY! Plus Paris Hilton is launching her 27th (… yes, 27th) fragrance and we want to know why there’s still so much hype around celebrity scents. And then, the Youtube drama clusterf**k that’s making its way into the mainstream. This week, Zara recommended consuming any content featuring Glennon Doyle, particularly her episode on ABC’s Conversations. Soooo, remember when Mich read only the misleading headline of an article, mistaking Russell Crowe’s New Zealand slang for Australia’s?

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Girl, Woman, Other | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/4TUECpHFW6uXX9WTSMH73n?si=9194d7e4555d4767 Shameless book nerds! How are ya!? Us? We are absolutely thrilled to bring you our very first Shameless Book Club chat of many, with a book we so adored. This month, we’re talking all about ‘Girl, Woman, Other’ by Bernardine Evaristo. As the joint winner of the 2019 Booker Prize, this book is a love song to Black womanhood in Britain, and follows the lives of twelve disparate characters.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Aisha Dee | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO WE ARE SO EXCITED FOR THIS EPISODE THERE’S SIMPLY NO TIME FOR PUNCTUATION Today on the show, we bring you the delightful Aisha Dee. You’ll likely know Aisha as the Australian actor who currently plays Kat Edison on The Bold Type. (And she also played Desi on the Australian classic, The Saddle Club, years ago. We know you watched it.) In this chat, we talk with Aisha about her upbringing in the Gold Coast, her big move to America, as well as her love for music, her family, and her co-stars Meghann and Katie.

item.title: Jenna Marbles de-platformed herself | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description GUESS WHO’S BAAAACCKKK!? (… Back again. Mich and Zara are back. Tell a friend. Sorry.) On today’s show: Scott Disick and Kourtney Kardashian may be getting back together and, well… we really hope not. Plus, YouTuber Jenna Marbles says she’s quitting Youtube after past racist videos. So, are we entering an era where celebrities are starting to de-platform themselves? And what do we expect from white influencers from here on in?

item.title: THE ARCHIVES: Mental health | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A BIG, CAPS LOCK HAPPY THURSDAY TO YOU, SHAMELESS PALS! If you haven’t listened to one of these before, this ‘The Archives’ series ventures deep into our backlog of chats to re-visit some of my (Annabelle’s) absolute favourite moments of Shameless interviews. Mich and Zara return from their mid-year break on Monday, so this will be the last bonus episode for a little while. Today, we’re talking about mental health.

item.title: THE ARCHIVES: Women and the media | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning to you, my friends! It’s Annabelle here! Mich and Zara are on their mid-year break for a couple more weeks (wipes away a single, dramatic tear), which means I’ve got a couple more bonus episodes up my sleeve until their return. If you’re unaware, this ‘The Archives’ series ventures back into our backlog of chats to re-visit some of my absolute favourite moments of Shameless interviews.

item.title: THE ARCHIVES: Success | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description BOO! IT’S ANNABELLE! WITH A SURPRISE EPISODE! As you might know already, the girls are on their mid-year break for three weeks, so I’ve put together a few bonus episodes of some of my favourite moments of Shameless interviews, to fill the Mich and Zara shaped hole in my podcast feed. (It was selfish of me, really.) Today’s theme is… success. How do some of Australia’s most accomplished people define it?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Mitch Orval | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HIYA FRIENDS! Today on the show, we bring you the vibrant Mitchell Orval. You’ll likely know Mitch as the co-creator of the Angry Dad YouTube channel and for the popular content he now creates with his partner, Chloe, on social media. In this chat, Mitch candidly talks about his past addiction to drugs and alcohol, as well as why he’s just buzzing to become a father very, very soon.

item.title: Anti-vaxxers and 'asking questions' | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey there, fabulous folks! On today’s show: The anti-vaxxer movement’s annoying PR glow-up. Plus, the ‘Call Her Daddy’ furore goes global. And then, how Emily Oberg killed her own brand, Sporty & Rich, in a matter of days. If you’d like to take action about what’s going on in the world right now, you can donate to the same charities Shameless Media has supported over the weekend: the Minnesota Freedom Fund and the North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Melissa Leong | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO! It goes without saying we’re super excited to share today’s episode with you! Today on the show, we bring you the glorious Melissa Leong. Melissa is a freelance food and travel writer, cookbook editor, radio broadcaster, and TV presenter. She’s been an esteemed food critic for publications like Time Out Sydney, and previously hosted SBS’s television series A Chef’s Line. She’s now working alongside Andy Allen and Jock Zonfrillo as a judge on Masterchef Australia, and has been requested as a guest on our show so many times we’ve honestly lost count.

item.title: Welcome to Media-geddon | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellloooooo and good morning, fellow pop culture junkies! On today’s show: The Anna Wintour tell-all causing a ruckus in the fashion industry. Plus, how a pandemic has put Only Fans in the spotlight. And then, can a decimated media industry be saved? But BEFORE WE GET ONTO ALL THE LINKS, LET’S GIVE YOU THE ONE THAT REALLY COUNTS! We will be announcing the details of our upcoming book in a very special newsletter drop tomorrow at 8AM.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Matt Okine | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happppppy Thursday! Feelin’ like a mood boost? This episode will do the trick. Today on the show, we bring you the warm and witty Matt Okine. Matt is a stand-up comedian, author, actor, and podcast host. You’ll likely be familiar with Matt’s work as the co-host of Triple J’s breakfast show from 2014 to 2016 alongside Alex Dyson, who he’s gone on to host a new podcast ‘All Day Breakfast’ with.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Turia Pitt | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description G’day! It’s Thursday! Hooray! Today on the show, we bring you the remarkable Turia Pitt. Turia is an author, mining engineer, athlete, and motivational speaker. In 2011, she was caught in a grassfire while running an ultramarathon, suffering severe burns to 65 per cent of her body as a result. In the almost decade since, Turia is now one of Australia’s most inspiring voices. In this chat, we ask Turia exactly how she responds to her inner critic, as well as whether there’s pressure that comes with being such a leading voice on resilience at a time like this.

item.title: What's in a name? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey! It’s Mondaaaayyy! On today’s show: We try to decode Elon Musk and Grimes’ baby name. Plus, is publicly calling out trolls online off limits when they’re under the age of 18? And finally, we finish with a conversation about the current state of foodie culture. This week, Zara recommended watching Normal People on Stan and eating Barbeque Shapes. (Not spon, just important.) Mich then recommended you get a Koala mattress.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Celia Pacquola | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy In Isolation Thursday, self-isolated pals! Today on the show, we bring you the very warm, very witty Celia Pacquola. When Celia isn’t winning Dancing with the Stars Australia, she’s busy being one of Australia’s best comedians, writers and actors. Celia - along with Luke McGregor - is the brains behind the award-winning comedy series, Rosehaven, on the ABC, and has also appeared in Utopia, The Beautiful Lie, and Have You Been Paying Attention.

item.title: The uncomfortable reality of internalised misogyny | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Well whaddya know! It’s Monday morning again! On today’s show: Meghan and Harry are releasing a book, but do the headlines tell the real story? Plus, a deep dive on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram experiment says about internalised misogyny. This week, Mich recommended you listen to the podcast, The Briefing, and Zara recommended the Stan series, The Loudest Voice. Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that’s CO.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Sammy Robinson | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning, you wonderful humans! Today on the show, we bring you the lovely Sammy Robinson. Sammy has grown a vast social media following after starting on YouTube only four years ago, uploading beauty tutorials from the comfort of her bedroom. Now, she works with fashion and beauty brands globally, and is about to launch her very own clothing label, One Mile. In our chat with Sammy, we touch on everything: From what it’s like launching One Mile when the world is in such chaos, to whether she thinks COVID-19 will change influencer culture forever after things start to shift back to normal.

item.title: God bless female Agents of Chaos | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Yoohoo! It’s us! We’ve missed you! On today’s show: Our very random and almost inexplicable obsession with tonal loungewear. Plus, why in the world does Dr Phil still have a platform but no practicing certificate. And finally, a deepdive on the Netflix show Too Hot to Handle and female agents of chaos (a term coined by by VICE’s Lauren O’Neill and Emma Garland that we LOVE). This week, Zara recommended you listen to Daniel Radcliffe’s podcast episode on Desert Island Discs here.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Osher Günsberg | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello helloooooo! Today on the show, we bring you someone who likely needs no introduction at all: Osher Günsberg. You probably fell in love with Osher when he was the host of Australian Idol all the way back in 2003. Since then, he’s gone on to become one of the country’s most successful television personalities as the host of The Bachelor, The Bachelorette and The Masked Singer. In our interview with Osher, we cover everything: From what it’s like filming in The Bachelor mansion, to his passion for spreading mental health and climate change awareness.

item.title: The Great Avocado Debate | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellloooooo Monday! Or is it Tuesday? Friday? On today’s show: How Masterchef reclaimed the Australian reality television throne after years of slumping ratings. Then, Reese Witherspoon’s Instagram marketing debacle, and finally, the very odd trend of sharing your #pandemicdreams online. This week, Mich recommended you bless your eyeballs with Unorthodox on Netflix. (Yeah yeah, Zara suggested you do the same last week, but just watch it, kay?). Zara recommended you listen to this episode of The Daily about the allegations levelled at Joe Biden, and this interview with Alain De Botton on How To Fail With Elizabeth Day.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: The Resilience Project’s Hugh van Cuylenburg | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning! Or arvo! Or night! We’re rambling! Today on the show, we bring you the uplifting Hugh van Cuylenburg. For those unaware, Hugh is the school teacher turned mental health pioneer behind The Resilience Project - an organisation that works with schools, sports clubs, and businesses to provide evidence-based, positive mental health strategies to build resilience and happiness. In our interview with Hugh, we talk about it all: From the pivotal trip to Northern India that changed his life, to the impact his sister’s battle with Anorexia Nervosa had on his perspective.

item.title: A love letter to Florence Pugh | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi there lovely listener friends! On today’s show: Are we finally seeing the death of influencer unboxings? Plus, the sharp rise of Florence Pugh and her epic handling of online trolling, and then, how conspiracy theories are given room to thrive in a period of time like this one. This week, Mich recommended you watch Lion on Netflix, and Zara recommended another Netflix goodie, Unorthodox. Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Brooke Boney | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s the day! The day we introduce you to our very first, very special In Isolation episode. On the show this week, we bring you the delightful Brooke Boney. Brooke is a Gamilaroi woman who grew up in Muswellbrook, NSW, and is currently an entertainment reporter on The Today Show. You’ll likely be familiar with her work before that too, as a journalist on NITV, the ABC, and Triple J.

item.title: Celebrity culture is crumbling | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A big, caps-locked HELLLLOOOO to you, Shameless besties! On today’s show: Mason Disick is the Instagram and Tik Tok deviant we didn’t know we needed right now. Plus, why Tiger King will perhaps be the most meme-able moment of 2020, and finally, the New York Times article that convinced us that celebrity culture may be crumbling right before us. This week, Mich recommended you all download Tik Tok and do this TV character personality test (Link pls Mich xxx).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Lana Wilkinson | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description OH HAI! Today on the show, we bring you the absolute dynamo that is Lana Wilkinson. Lana is a celebrity stylist who has dressed the likes of Megan Gale, Rebecca Judd, Ruby Rose, and Zoe Foster Blake as well as a designer, having launched her own self-titled shoe brand in 2019. Given the state of the world, we were feeling a little deflated when we walked into this interview with Lana two weeks ago, but our moods were immediately lifted by Lana’s kindness and light, as well as her insights into pursuing your career and making your big dreams a reality.

item.title: We want to lie down | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello hello, lovely people! On today’s show: How the satirical news website Betoota Advocate somehow, oh so cleverly, Trojan-horsed us all. Plus, a discussion on the reignited Kimye/Taylor Swift feud, and finally, why the concept of self-optimising in this time of self isolation is kinda annoying. This week, Mich recommended the Netflix show Tiger King and Zara recommended the app HouseParty. Looking for that collection of hilarious conference call stories on Jules Von Hep’s Instagram?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Dylan Alcott | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiiiiii listener friends! You asked, we listened. Today, we bring you the man you’ve all been wanting on the show for quite some time: the utterly impressive Dylan Alcott. Dylan is a professional athlete, media personality, motivational speaker, bestselling author, and disability advocate. (And us? We’re completely out of breath just typing that.) In this episode, we talk about the childhood moment that shaped Dylan’s approach to life, his career jump from pro basketball to tennis, and the love story with his partner Chantelle.

item.title: Calabasas Lobster | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description The greatest of mornings to you all, Shameless family! On today’s show: We hear from a few of your lovely voices via our brand new Shameless hotline. Then, we talk about the Hayley Williams profile that made us think a little deeper about female anger and how to harness it. Finally, a conversation on the lipstick effect and self care in an era of economic downturn. Zara recommended two episodes of the podcast This American Life: The Show of Delights episode and their Birds & Bees episode.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brooke Jowett | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description OH HELLO! Happy In Conversation day, listener friend! Today on the show, we’re joined by the sunny Brooke Jowett. If you’re a fan of Survivor Australia, you’ll no doubt be familiar with Brooke, who has now appeared on two separate seasons of the show (the first, which aired in 2016, and the one on your television screens right now!). In this episode, we talk about how Brooke made a name for herself as a fierce competitor on the show so many of us adore, as well as how she feels about dominating headlines lately.

item.title: A little dose of joy | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh hi there, glorious listener pals! Today on the show: A discussion on how we seek out joy during a time of overwhelmingly rampant news coverage. Where are the slithers of light amongst the dark? Where is the line between being educated about world events and being utterly overwhelmed? Then, we jump right to the biggest pop culture news story of the week - the Woody Allen memoir that was pulled just before its release to the public.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jules Von Hep | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday to all our fine-footed friends in the world! Today on the show we are joined by Jules Von Hep, who we also like to refer to as a human ray of sunshine. Jules is a celebrity tanning expert, the founder of tanning juggernaut Isle of Paradise, co-host of the Jules and Sarah podcast and champion of body confidence. We first met Jules last year when we hosted MECCALAND and were immediately drawn to him: he is one of the kindest, warmest, most exuberant humans we have ever had the pleasure of meeting through this job.

item.title: Do you have 'interxiety'? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday! AND a public holiday! AAAAND episode drop day! Hooray! On today’s show: Toilet paper. Yes, you know exactly what we’re talking about. The great Australian toilet paper shortage of 2020 that’s left us completely perplexed. Plus, we look into The Bachelor Australia’s false start with their announcement of Locky Gilbert as next season’s star. And finally, how ‘interxiety’ - a term we most definitely made up - has kept us up this week.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Neroli Meadows | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Yoohoo! It’s us again, rudely interrupting your Thursday morning! (And we aren’t even sorry about it.) Today on the show, we’re joined by the delightfully vibrant Neroli Meadows: one of the country’s leading sports commentators and television presenters. In this episode, we dive into it all: From Neroli’s close relationship with her siblings to the highlights of working her way up in a male dominated industry. We also touch on what grappling with losing a job is like when it’s so tied to your personal and public identity, as well as how Neroli has dealt with re-shaping her career after rejection.

item.title: A royal case of Insta fraud | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY! And the happiest hello to you, Shameless fam! On today’s show: The very curious, very convincing theory that Will and Kate (yes, the royal ones) have bought Instagram followers. Plus, a discussion on Harvey Weinstein’s conviction and the aftermath of it all. Finally, we talk about a woman’s nightmarish revelation that her ex-boyfriend of seven years is now dating… Lady Gaga. This week, Mich recommended the podcast Dying For Sex.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Courtney Act | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hiya friends! Strap yourselves in, ‘cause this one’s a goodie. (Are we allowed to say that about our own podcast episode? Screw it. IT’S AMAZING.) Today we’re joined by the ridiculously entertaining Courtney Act: a drag queen, entertainer and singer who has graced television screens across not just in Australia, but around the world. In this episode, we talk about it all: from Courtney’s schooling experience in Brisbane as Shane Jenek, to how Courtney Act came to life.

item.title: The one where 'Mercury retrograde' breaks us | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY TEAM! On today’s show: Why the heck does everyone keep talking about Mercury being in retrograde? Plus, what the death of Caroline Flack says about internet culture and then, how Ben Affleck is pulling out all the stops to win back the affection of the public. This week, Mich recommended going to a discount Adidas store lol which definitely isn’t a proper recommendation but we are rolling with it anyway.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Zoë Foster Blake | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description YES! Today is the day. And from this point on, the 20th of February 2020 will be forever known as Shameless Christmas. Also, the day with the best numerology in the history of the universe (20/02/2020 - what a date, what a time). But enough about number orgasms! This is about Zoë, AKA former beauty journalist, the author of ten books and the founder of Go-To (and Bro-To… and Gro-To) Skin Care.

item.title: Say hello to ‘medfluencers’ | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description WAHOOOOO IT’S MONDAY! Thanks so much for giving us your ears for this hour of power. On today’s show: WHO WON DOGGO OF SHAMELESS? Plus! The divorce announcement that we care about deeply and the rise of medfluencers - doctors, dieticians and nurses who are making money on Instagram. And - finally - the opinion piece on the Karen meme that was so contentious, it was the top trending topic on Twitter in Australia over the weekend.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nawal Sari | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description GOOD MORNING! GOOD THURSDAY! GOOD LISTENER FRIENDS! Today on the show, we have the glorious Nawal Sari. Nawal is an influencer committed to redefining modest fashion, and has turned her love of fashion into a burgeoning career. In this interview, we sit down to discuss Nawal’s decision to wear the hijab in high school, as well as what it’s like becoming a bit of an accidental big sister to a community of 120,000 young women.

item.title: Teen mags screwed us up | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description A very happy Monday to you, lovely people! On today’s show: a look back at all the effed articles we consumed in teenage magazines. Plus, we watched Gwyneth Paltrow’s new Netflix special Goop Lab and have lots of thoughts and then, why people suddenly became prudish when Shakira and JLo took their clothes off at the Superbowl halftime show. Mich recommended Chasing Cosby, and Zara recommended last week’s episode of Four Corners called Black Summer.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rosie Waterland | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO GLORIOUS LISTENERS! Today on the show we are joined by Rosie Waterland. Rosie is a writer and comedian who began her career writing recaps of The Bachelor for Mamamia. Since then, she’s achieved so much we honestly feel a little dizzy, err, recapping it all. Rosie has written two bestselling books - The Anti Cool Girl and Every Lie I’ve Ever Told - hosted an award-winning podcast, My Mum Says My Memoir is a Lie, toured Australia with two sold out one-woman shows (with a third coming!

item.title: From Kobe to Taylor | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description OH FAM, IT’S A BIG ONE THIS WEEK. Happy Monday! Today we go everywhere from the very random, very silly Instagram feud between influencer Mitchell Orval and food critic John Lethlean, the tragic death and complicated legacy of Kobe Bryant and then, the Taylor Swift documentary we’d been waiting weeks for. Some links for you from today’s show: Mich recommended this New York Times profile of Jessica Simpson and Zara recommended this episode of The Hollywood Reporter’s Awards Chatter podcast.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgie Stone | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY THURSDAY LISTENER FRIENDS! Coming up today: a very special episode with 2019’s youngest recipient of an Order of Australia Medal, Georgie Stone. For those unacquainted, Georgie is a Neighbours actress and trans rights activist. Oh, and did we mention she’s only 19? If you’d like to follow Georgie on Instagram, please do so @georgiestone. As for us? We’re @shamelesspodcast. A big thank you to today’s sponsor, WhatsMine App.

item.title: So do we call them ‘Braniston’ or ‘Anipitt’? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY, WONDERFUL LISTENER FRIENDS! Man oh man, do we have a lot to talk about. Firstly, let’s cover the Triple J Hottest 100, and what the results over the last three decades say about us. Then, every little thing about BRAD AND JEN (!!!!!!) and the Alec Baldwin interview that made our mouths hit the floor. This week, Mich recommended Sex Education on Netflix. Zara recommended you go see Little Women at your local cinema and that you listen to The Daily’s episode on Meghan and Harry.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Clementine Ford | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s our first In Conversation of 2020 and it’s a gooooood one. Today on the show we are joined by the formidable force that is Clementine Ford. Of course, you’re likely to know Clem for her writing on feminism and as the author of Fight Like a Girl and Boys will be Boys. But who is Clem Ford behind the writing and activism we know so well? We sat down with Clem in her Melbourne home to chat all about her work, yes, but what it was like growing up all over the Middle East and how motherhood changed everything.

item.title: Beware the women!!! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description AAAAND WE ARE BACK!!! Happy happy happy 2020 Shameless fam - we couldn’t be more excited for our first episode of the year. So, what’s on the agenda? One of the biggest Youtube star’s comes out as transgender. Plus, what the actual eff happened to the royal family while we were away, and how do we feel about Megxit? Then, some thoughts on influencers, Instagram brands, and public shaming.

item.title: In 2020 #IPledge | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey friends! Happy New Year! We hope you’ve enjoyed some much-deserved time out with your loved ones. Today we are re-sharing one of our favourite episodes of 2019 - our In Conversation episode with Natalie Fornasier. We first came across Natalie and her story when she sat down with Byrdie.com.au in 2018 for a piece titled “I’m 24 and Living With Advanced Melanoma—This Is My Story”. Natalie’s words and insights in that interview were what informed our very last segment of Shameless in 2018, and what pushed us to change our own relationship with sun tanning forever.

item.title: The end of a decade | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description IT’S THE FINAL EPISODE OF THE YEAR AND IT’S A CHRISTMAS SPECIAL! KINDA. Well, look, there will be presents and this Christmas jingle and we did probably consume a little too much champagne while recording it. What are we TALKING about though?! Well, there’s the curious Christmas Instagram campaign that is unlike anything we’ve seen. Plus, the best pop culture moments of the last decade, and the Chrissy Teigen and John Legend argument that sings to our souls.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Zara and Mich! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description WELL, WELL, WELL! It’s our last In Conversation episode of 2019 and today on the show you’re joined, actually… today you’re joined by us. Yes, we sat down with the effervescent Sarah Davidson at the Mercedes me store on Tuesday night for an In Conversation with the two of us. A huge, huge thank you to Mercedes me for having us in their beautiful space - their Melbourne is one of 11 Mercedes me locations worldwide, sitting alongside other iconic cities including Munich, Hamburg, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Moscow.

item.title: Generation 'Instagram Face' | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY SECOND MONDAY BEFORE CHRISTMAS SHAMELESS FAM AND YES WE WILL KEEP YELLING ABOUT THIS UNTIL AFTER CHRISTMAS. On the show today: Our obsession with finding words and colours to define the year that was. Plus, the age of Instagram Face and then, a look at Rihanna’s 2019: one that saw her the centre of the public consciousness, despite not releasing a second of music. Zara recommended Morning Wars on Apple TV and Mich recommended Terrace House on Netflix.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bel Sloane | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello lovely listeners! Today we have a powerful interview with Bel Sloane. In case you’re not familiar with her name, Bel is a television presenter for Channel 7. She’s also the wife of AFL star and captain of the Adelaide Crows, Rory Sloane. In 2018, Bel and Rory lost their first child Leo, who was born sleeping. In this interview, we talk about that grief, but also the love that Leo brought to both of their lives.

item.title: We need to talk about Drake | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday! The third last Monday before CHRISTMAS!!!! So, happy third last Monday before Christmas Shameless fam. On the show today: The allure of a cool company and how they are transcending pop culture, Billie Eilish’s comments about Drake that have much of the celebrity world talking and then, a very special instalment of Zara Predicts. Today Zara recommended the app Smiling Mind and Mich recommended Revolution’s Overnight Blemish Lotion.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Steph Claire Smith | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s little Friday and boy, are we happy about it! Today we’ve got a good one for you, because we are joined by the powerhouse that is Steph Claire Smith. Or, now, Miller. Steph entered the public consciousness as a model, and a wildly successful one at that, but since then has crafted a career that exists well beyond the modelling industry. Today, she is the co-founder of fitness app Keep it Cleaner, sunglass company Soda Shades and bikini brand Midnight.

item.title: Manufacturing a pop star | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description IT’S MOOOONDAY!!!!! On today’s show: what the rise of singer songwriter Tones and I says about the music industry in 2019, the photos of Justin Timberlake holding the hand of his co-star and then, the Selena Gomez AMAs performance that was… shaky, at best. Zara recommended you don’t spend $20 watching Last Christmas. Mich wants you to read Pachinko! Read it! Today’s episode was made possible by our sponsor Lahana Swim.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Emma Carey | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy, happy, happy Thursday you wonderful people! Em is known as the girl who fell from the sky: at just 20 years old, when skydiving in Switzerland, her parachute failed to open properly. She plummeted from the sky, landing on the ground completely paralysed from the waist down. She spent months in hospital re-learning how to move her body again. Today, Emma is a walking paraplegic. As she documented her recovery and her re-birth (as she now calls it) Emma built a hugely loyal following thanks to her sunny and warm and thoughtful posts.

item.title: One royal f-up | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY EVERYBODY! It’s a new week and we need to talk about all the life admin stuff we suck at. Then, what the actual HELL happened in that Prince Andrew interview with the BBC, and is TikTok the next Instagram? Zara recommended you watch Years and Years on SBS. Mich wants you to buy the To Save Face SPF50+ sunscreen from Mecca Cosmetica. Today’s episode was made possible by our sponsor Eastland.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Clare Bowditch | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy, happy, happy Thursday our favourite listeners! Today on the show, we’re joined by Clare Bowditch, a musician and actress who has now released her memoir, Your Own Kind of Girl, a book that explores the stories we tell ourselves and what happens when we believe them. In this episode we talk about what it’s like to lose a sister, be sent to a diet doctor when you’re still in primary school, and accept yourself when the world tells you that you shouldn’t.

item.title: OK, Boomer | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HIYA and HAPPY MONDAY LOVELY PEOPLE! Coming up on today’s show: it was a big night for reality TV finales on Thursday and the results sparked a rather furious divide between Australians: when it comes to daylight savings and the shows airing at different times in different states, whose responsibility is it to keep the result under wraps? Plus, a conversation about celebrity fundraisers in the wake of natural disasters and then, the OK Boomer meme that has infiltrated the internet.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Erin Brockovich | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Helloooooo, favourite listener friends! Today on the show we have the enigmatic Erin Brockovich. In the year 2000, the award-winning film starring Julia Roberts told the true story of Erin’s involvement in a case against a Californian power company. Ever since, Erin has continued to work in the environmental sphere and has regularly visited Australia as the ambassador for Shine Lawyers. In our chat with Erin, we asked her about her environmental activism, what it’s like coming into such a large sum of money so unexpectedly, and her relationship with the label “feminist icon”.

item.title: Are you a troll? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Helloooooo and HAPPY MONDAY WONDERFUL LISTENER PEOPLE! Coming up on today’s show: the mummy blogger who outed herself as a troll. Plus, what do we make of American rapper T.I. admitting that he forces his 18-year-old daughter to undergo virginity tests? Then the debate on dresses with pockets that precisely none of you asked for! This week, Zara recommends you… uhh… listen to Christmas music (???). Mich recommends you buy her el cheapo Michael Bublé perfume, By Invitation.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sophie Cachia | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Thursday mates! Boy do we have a cracker of an episode in store. Today we are joined by the force of nature that is Sophie Cachia - blogger, presenter and one of Australia’s most influential voices. Here, we talk about falling pregnant at the age of 22, finding your feet in a sea of commentary and feedback, and how to navigate a marriage breakdown when you’re still figuring out your sexuality.

item.title: Textbook faux-mance | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description AS ALWAYS, HAPPY MONDAY LOVELY PEOPLE! On today’s show: Schapelle Corby re-releases her book, but where exactly is the money going? Plus, just a couple bandwagoners delving deep into Shawn Mendes and then the Chrissy Teigen and John Legend profile that piqued our interest. And we are so excited to announce our live show partners for November in Sydney and Brisbane. Our shows will be presented by ANZ who are helping young Australians boost their financial wellbeing and The Body Shop, helping busy women relax and unwind since 1976.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Marlee Silva | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Thursday, wonderful humans! Today on the show we have the ever impressive Marlee Silva. Marlee Silva is a Kamilaroi/Dunghutti woman and the founder of Tiddas 4 Tiddas, a movement that shines a light on the stories of Indigenous women across the country. Marlee is also a national youth advisor for the Red Cross and spends much of her time speaking across the country to change the conversation around the Indigenous experience.

item.title: Meet the new Jenna Dewan | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY HAPPY HAPPY Monday to our favourite Shameless people! On the agenda today: The Jenna Dewan and Channing Tatum divorce that was far grittier than their official statement ever let on. Plus, the landmark ruling that could shake up the reality TV industry and a meaty discussion on the merits and shortcomings of marriage. This week, Zara recommends an old episode of Ladies We Need to Talk called Settling for Average, and Mich was SUPPOSED to recommend a banger playlist Triple J’s Bridget Hustwaite made for us after our interview with her went live, but got so caught up in the “I’m not Joey” stuff she totally forgot.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bridget Hustwaite | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, wonderful people! Today we’re sitting down with Bridget Hustwaite, the host of Triple J’s Good Nights, the founder of Endogram, and ambassador for Endometriosis Australia. We sat down with Bridget a little over a month ago in her Melbourne apartment to talk all things burnout, workism, music and endo and found her insights to be so illuminating. Want more from Bridget? Of-bloody-course you do! Follow her on Instagram @bridgethustwaite or over at @endogram.

item.title: Kyle, Jackie O and PC pushback | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy new week, pals! Coming up on today’s show: Kanye West would like his wife Kim Kardashian to stop being sexy, please and thank you. Then, how the country’s most controversial radio personalities landed the biggest pay packets in Australian media history, and our thoughts on PR guru Roxy Jacenko’s Paddington Poo Jogger. This week, Zara recommended Kate Leaver’s story on marriage in Future Women. Mich recommended you go see HUSTLERS at the cinema!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jan Fran | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY THURSDAY lovely people! Today on the show we are joined by the one and only Jan Fran. Of course, Jan Fran is an Australian journalist and presenter and presenter, best known for her work co-hosting SBS’ The Feed. Outside of that, though, Jan is also a bit of a podcast fiend, hosting The Few Who Do alongside Marc Fennell and having hosted Sexism and the City, too. Jan has shot and produced documentaries from all over the world, as well as occasionally appearing as a commentator on The Project Q&A, ABC Breakfast, Paul Murray Live, Studio 10, The Latest, The Today Show and The Drum.

item.title: The best trash story of 2019 | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description IT’S A NEW WEEK! WEEEEEE! LET’S AVOID THE MISERY TOGETHER! Coming up on today’s show: The Herald Sun story that made us tear our hair out. Plus! An explainer on the WAGatha Christie tweets you’ve definitely seen about Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy (AKA THE BEST TRASH STORY OF THE YEAR - NAY - THE MILLENNIUM), and a deep dive on Ellen DeGeneres’s friendship with controversial former US President, George Bush.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Abbie Chatfield | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hellooooo! Happy Thursday, lovely Shameless listeners! Today we’re sitting down with Abbie Chatfield - the 24-year-old runner up on this year’s season of The Bachelor. We wouldn’t hop on a plane to Brisbane for just any Bachelor contestant; but we did for Abbie because we think her time in the public eye has been fascinating. Abbie is considered one of the most controversial Bachelor contestants in history for one, curious reason: Abbie likes talking about sex.

item.title: Erin Molan is not your punching bag | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Monday, folks! Coming up on today’s show: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott split, and it’s a story not without a bunch of subplots. Plus, an explainer on the Erin Molan and Andrew Johns controversy (and how it exposes the NRL’s continued sexism problem) and the most ridiculous TV show on Australian television is The Masked Singer and we can’t stop talking about it. This week, Zara recommended the book ‘She Said’.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jo Weston | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy, happy, happy Thursday lovely people! Today on the show we have the delightful Jo Weston. For those unaware, Jo is goal defence for the Australian Diamonds netball team, and has been a star of the Melbourne Vixens since she was basically a teenager. Here, we talk to Jo all about what life is like as an athlete, how heartbreak and guilt overlap after a big loss and the work she thinks needs to be done in the space of women’s sport.

item.title: Oh, sugar | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaaappy Monday, wonderful listeners! Coming up on today’s show: a little sugar hit from the Brownlow red carpet. Plus, why do so many men hate Greta Thunberg, and the Sarah Wilson ‘I Quit Sugar’ blaze that started in the Daily Mail and has sparked spot fires all over social media. Zara recommended ‘How to survive a Twitter storm’ in The Guardian. Mich recommended checking out Gary Vee’s podcast.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brandon Jack | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Thursday, friends! Please welcome THE FIRST EVER MAN to Shameless In Conversations! How wild. What a niche. For those unfamiliar, Brandon Jack was born with sporting prowess in his blood; Brandon grew up with a father, Garry, who was a star player and coach in the rugby league. His brother Kieren was an AFL premiership player, and for a time was captain of the Sydney Swans. Brandon gave professional sport a crack himself - he played alongside Kieren at Sydney from 2013 to 2017 - before deciding his passion was writing.

item.title: A Survivor GoFundMe | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HIYA! Happy Monday, lovely people. Today’s show is a biiiig one: How a Survivor contestant was the recipient of GoFundMe’s third biggest fundraiser ever, the Bachelor contestant with a suspiciously-timed weight-loss program and the influencer who sparked a racist furore this week. Zara recommended following @thedailyaus on Instagram. Meanwhile, keep your eyes peeled on our socials for our charity merch! $10 from every tee will be going straight towards Sacred Heart Mission’s Women’s House.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Priya Serrao | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! Happy Thursday! Today we are joined by Miss Universe Australia, Priya Serrao, a woman who defies the mould of what constitutes a beauty queen. Priya is beautiful, yes, but it’s her brain that we find most impressive: she has interned for the United Nations in developing countries, has a law degree under her belt, is a vocal force for greater diversity and representation in the media, and works toward enacting change via her day job in public policy.

item.title: The bloodsport of hating Caroline Calloway | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a new week and we have a lot to talk about, pals! Starting with Taylor Swift performing at the Melbourne Cup. Then, the Caroline Calloway saga that just won’t die (with a lil recap for those of you who have no idea what any of that means), and the think piece about performative friendships that had us squealing in delight. Zara recommended Will and Woody’s video on depression for R U OK Day.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jess Quinn | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday lovely Shameless fam! Today, we are joined by the remarkable Jess Quinn. When Jess was nine, her life was thrown into disarray by a cancer diagnosis. Within the year, she would lose all of her hair, and then, one of her legs. Now, Jess has turned her biggest hurdle into her biggest triumph - her career is built on the prosthetic limb she wears every day, helping her show her 180,000 Instagram followers that beauty comes in many different sizes and forms.

item.title: Two cashmere bras, please | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday wonderful listener friends! Coming up on today’s show: Katie Holmes’ bradigan, Scarlett Johansson’s consistent foot-in-mouth disease, and the Man Repeller article on age, success and career that got us talking. This week Mich recommended subscribing to Squiz Shortcuts. Zara recommended you get cultured and go see Come From Away! Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Leigh Campbell | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday! Today we are joined by the delightful Leigh Campbell. If we are talking expert voices in the beauty and lifestyle space, Leigh’s the ultimate go-to. You probably grew up reading her columns and insights in Cosmopolitan magazine, or, later on, in the Huffington Post Australia. Or, perhaps, you found Leigh not through her work as a journalist and editor, but as a blogger; last year, she penned the wildly popular series Treading Water about her experience with infertility and miscarriage.

item.title: Vloggers, vegans and vitriol | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaaappy Monday, gorgeous listener friends! Coming up on today’s show: the Bachelor bombshell we’re calling bulls**t on. Plus, the rise and fall of social media veganism and why Harry Styles is the enigma women can’t get enough of. Today Zara recommended Loving Tan and Stanley Tucci’s interview on Love Stories with Dolly Alderton. Mich recommended James Cosmetics’ eye masks! FILL IN OUR SHAMELESS LISTENER SURVEY HERE (we will love you FOR-EV-ER!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Cyan Ta’eed | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday friends! We’re joined today by serial entrepreneur Cyan Ta’eed, who has gone from working out of her parents’ basement in 2006 to building a tech empire in her online design and photography hub, Envato. Over the last couple of years, Cyan has directed her energy and efforts into Hey Tiger, an ethical chocolate brand that functions as a social enterprise, where each bar sold helps community development projects for cocoa farming communities in West Africa.

item.title: Nadia Bartel and media bread-crumbing | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday you glorious humans! Coming up on today’s show: The Jada Pinkett Smith profile we can’t get enough of, the breakdown of a Bartel marriage and finally, the rise of compassion fatigue: how much can we really care about everything, all the time? Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Ash London | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, lovely people! Today, we’re sitting down with Ash London. If you’re unfamiliar with the name, Ash is a powerhouse in the radio industry, spearheading Ash London Live on the Hit Network. When she’s not behind a mic, she’s busy carving out quite the career across television too. We sat down with Ash in our Sydney hotel room to chat about quitting your dream job, moving overseas in search for something more, and the beauty of serendipity.

item.title: The unruly rebellion of Miley Cyrus | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi friends! Happy new week! What a time to be alive! We’re almost at the end of winter, HOORAY! Coming up on today’s show: the sneaky new way to buy Instagram followers. Plus, how the royal family became embroiled in the Jeffrey Epstein saga, and why the media finds Miley Cyrus so goddamn difficult. This week Mich recommended Sam Cavanagh’s interview with the Daily Talk Show boys. Listen here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tanya Hennessy | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday wonderful people! Today we are joined by Tanya Hennessy, the woman who knows millennials inside out. If you haven’t seen Tanya in your Facebook newsfeed with her witty videos, you’ve probably read her best-selling book ‘Am I Doing This Right’ or heard about her in-demand comedy tour, ‘Low Expectations’. In this conversation, we cover everything from finding your career calling, to mental illness and trolling. Want more from Tanya?

item.title: Shredding for the wedding | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday wonderful people! Coming up on today’s episode: the influencer who ended her career by uploading the wrong Youtube video. Plus, the New York Times wants you to get “strong” for your wedding day, but by “strong” we’re pretty sure they mean “skinny”. Also, what’s with all these television reboots? Mich recommended this profile on Taylor Swift: https://www.vogue.com/article/taylor-swift-cover-september-2019 Zara recommended this episode of ABC’s Conversations with Richard Fidler: https://www.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Emma Isaacs | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY THURSDAY! Today on the show we have the inimitable Emma Issacs. Emma is a serial entrepreneur: she is the global CEO of Business Chicks, Australia’s largest business community for women and last year published her first book, Winging It. We sat down with Emma in our tiny makeshift studio at Zara’s house to chat all things success, failure and building brands. For more from Emma, you can buy her book here or follow her on Instagram.

item.title: A $3.2 million Youtube wedding | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPPPY MONDAAAAAY! On today’s episode of Shameless: the two Youtube stars who got (fake?) married, our thoughts on the new season of The Bachelor Australia, and the popularisation of polyamory. Mich recommended the latest ep of She’s On The Money, ‘A rookies guide to investing’, here: https://podcasts.apple.com/au/podcast/shes-on-the-money/id1468033698 Zara recommended this pod interview with Ricky Gervais: https://samharris.org/podcasts/163-ricky-gervais/ Thanks so much to Sportsgirl’s Be That Girl movement for making this episode of Shameless possible.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgia Love | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy, happy, happy Thursday! Today on the show we are joined by the one and only Georgia Love. You probably have all the background in the world on who Georgia Love is, but let us quickly recap: Georgia is a journalist, our former Bachelorette and television personality who is sunny and kind and one of the warmest people we have ever met. In this episode we talk about everything from grief, to starring on reality TV and falling in love to what comes next.

item.title: Rumours, smoke and fire | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday beautiful people! Coming up on today’s episode: the Novak Djokovic rumours that just won’t go away. Plus, is Masterchef doomed now that its three hosts have walked away? And how Diet Prada is achieving what mainstream media never could. Mich recommended two things this week! The MCoBeauty Instant Brows pencil (here: https://modelco.com/shop/mcobeauty/instantbrows) and Grotti Lotti prints for your next impressive present (here: https://grottilotti.com.au). Zara recommended the Phoebe Waller-Bridge/Fleabag episode of How To Fail with Elizabeth Day.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: PJ Harding | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, Shameless family! Today we’re sitting down with Polly ‘PJ’ Harding, one half of KIIS FM’s Jase and PJ breakfast show. In this chat, we covered everything from moving overseas to pursue your passion, what it’s like to have a story about your ‘coregasm’ go viral, and being asked to hone your best (or… worst) Aussie accent by watching episodes of Home and Away. If you love Polly as much as we do, find her on Instagram @pjdeeday.

item.title: Examine your annoyance | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello! Happy Monday, gorgeous listener friends! Today we’re sharing the unpopular opinion on Instagram removing likes. Plus, the Adam Goodes documentary that every Australian needs to watch and how brands are being pulled into influencer controversies. Read Zara’s recommended article here: https://www.huffpost.com/entry/how-to-help-a-grieving-friend_n_5aa9801fe4b0004c0406d2fb Today’s epic remix is from Stephanie Alexopoulos. Thank you for the lols, Stephanie! Today’s sponsor is Tribe Skincare. Get 10% off your order AND FREE EXPRESS SHIPPING (!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgie Dent | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today on the show we have the warm, generous and stupidly clever Georgie Dent. Georgie is a former lawyer, a journalist, an old editor of ours and the author of the new and best-selling memoir, Breaking Badly. At 24, things were going pretty good for Georgie. She’d landed a job at a prestigious Sydney law firm, was living with her boyfriend and had so much head of her. But, in her own words, she broke.

item.title: Complicated celebrity comebacks | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Heya! On today’s show: Rebecca Black is officially back and so is Aziz Ansari. And later, how do we feel about women photoshopping their bodies to be larger than they are? Zara recommends Uroll.Me and Mich recommends listening to Extremes by Vice. (Royalty free music for Michelle’s weird remix c/o Artistic Maniacs.) Shameless is a production of Shameless Media. Transcript

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Em Rusciano | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today’s In Conversation episode is with one firecracker of a human, Em Rusciano. We adore Em for her wit and intelligence, but most of all her honesty and vulnerability. She is one of a kind and we hope you enjoy this chat about career, family and life in the public eye. Oh, and a note before we dive in - Em talks with her hands, which means you might hear some noises here and there!

item.title: Byron Bay Murfers | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! On today’s show: the strange furore around the re-imagination of Disney’s Ariel, how Taylor Swift’s fans are pushing her feud with Scooter Braun into dangerous territory and the Byron Bay influencers who graced the pages of the world’s best article in Vanity Fair. Thanks so much to the very lovely Stephanie Alexopoulos for this week’s remix! If you want to get involved and remix one of Zara’s best sayings, please email your mp3 submission to hello@shamelessmediaco.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brooke Blurton | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday! Today on the show we have the very lovely, very bubbly, Brooke Blurton. You may remember Brooke from her time on The Bachelor and The Bachelor in Paradise, but in truth, Brooke’s story is about far more than her short foray on reality TV. Our conversation covers her childhood, her identity and her love of her job as a youth worker. If you love Brooke as much as we do, find her on Instagram @brooke.

item.title: Goodness gracious, Tom Gleeson | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday, Shameless family! Coming up on today’s show: the radio campaign that uses silence to talk about mental health. Plus, we need to talk about the Logies and that Tom Gleeson speech, and the celebrity sexual assault story that slipped through the cracks this week. Want to try Mich’s recommendation recipe? You can do that here! https://www.taste.com.au/recipes/speedy-mince-haloumi-one-pot-recipe/t8yhqacv Want to support Shameless? The best way to do that is to click ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts and leave a rating and review, or click ‘follow’ on Spotify.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Gemma Watts | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today we are doing things a little differently. In fact, today’s episode is brought to you live from the Mercedes Me store in Melbourne, where we sat down with beauty writer, podcaster and all-round genuine legend Gemma Watts. WE HOPE YOU ENJOY X Transcript

item.title: Ruminations on an inferior dip | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description WE BAAAAAAACK. It’s been a two-week break but it feels like a lifetime lovely people. So, what’s on the agenda today? How a couple of former AFL Footballers proved exactly why this podcast exists, the accusations that Taylor Swift is co-opting the gay rights movement and why the hell hummus and Keanu Reeves have gone viral. Mich recommends Breaking Badly by Georgie Dent and Zara recommends More Than Enough by Elaine Welteroth.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Flex Mami | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, lovely Shameless listeners! Today, we’re sitting down with the inimitable Flex Mami - a wildly talented DJ, television personality, podcaster and author. We sat down at her home in Sydney to talk about career, intersectional feminism, and harnessing your own unique voice. Follow Flex Mami on Instagram @flex.mami and listen to her brilliant podcast, Bobo and Flex, on Apple Podcasts and Spotify. Thanks so much to Nourished Life for sponsoring this episode of Shameless.

item.title: Won't somebody think of the influencers? | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO AND HAPPY MONDAY BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE! On today’s episode: the dating app for private school kids, is influencing actually a “hard job”, and why Leonardo DiCaprio exclusively dates women under the age of 25. Loved this week’s remix? Go check out Oh Boy on Insta @OhBoyMusic or on Spotify. Thanks so much to GoodnessMe Box for making this episode possible. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout to receive 15% off your winter wholefood market tickets!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Edwina Bartholomew | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today we’re sitting down with the charming and effervescent Edwina Bartholomew - a journo and television personality who has covered some of the country’s biggest stories and interviewed some of the world’s brightest minds. You can find more from Eddie on Instagram @edwina_b. As for us, you’ll find us there too @shamelesspodcast. Thanks so much to Bed Threads for making this episode possible. Use code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout to receive 10% off!

item.title: Stars are blind | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Iiiiiit’s Monday! Happy Monday! On today’s show: why do we care so much about Kim Kardashian’s spelling mistakes? Plus, the rise and rise of astrology amongst young women, and why an airplane flight and plate of beef has seen Emma Thompson be labelled a “first class hypocrite”. You can read Glamour’s profile on Aurora Perrineau here. Shameless is a production of Shameless Media. Transcript

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jadé Tunchy | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday, Shameless family! Today, we’re sitting down with the very witty, very warm Jadé Tuncdoruk - a woman who has garnered an audience of almost 500,000 on Instagram through her funny captions, stunning photography, and down-to-earth musings. We cover everything from bullying, to seeking psychological help and building a personal brand from the ground up. Find Jadé on Instagram @jadetunchy and @therealjadetunchy. We are @shamelesspodcast. Thanks so much to Frank Body for sponsoring this episode of Shameless.

item.title: A pop culture piñata | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description AS PROMISED SHAMELESS FAM… keep listening for the world’s worst remix of Zara quoting Bhad Bhabie. On today’s show - an embarrassing confession about Lizzo, how James Charles became a pop culture pinata, and how some of the world’s most famous faces have railed against America’s abortion law crisis. If you’re interested in the Ask Polly column Zara recommends, you can here. Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Kate Wasley | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Thursday you Shameless humans! On the show today we have the legend that is Kate Wasley. You might know Kate from her time as one half of AnyBody.co, a movement she co-founded that encouraged women to brace their bodies, no matter the size. As an in-demand model and influencer herself, Kate has graced the coveted pages of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition in 2018. But perhaps her most important role is the one she plays in our conversations about body image online.

item.title: A birth and a funeral | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey wonderful Shameless friends! Coming up on today’s show: the royal bebe, The Daily Mail’s intense interest in Margot Robbie’s grandmother’s funeral, and - OF COURSE - the Met Gala. To read Zara’s Harper’s Bazaar recommendation, click here: https://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/features/a27259689/toxic-masculinity-male-friendships-emotional-labor-men-rely-on-women/ Want to meet us at Meccaland? Use the code SHAMELESS to receive 50% off a double-pass for you and your best friend! http://bit.ly/2V4n01r Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: The Veronicas | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello Shameless family! Today we are joined by the powerhouses that make up The Veronicas - arguably Australia’s most recognisable female band. We caught up with twin sisters Jess and Lisa Origliasso in Brunswick to chat about the meaning behind their new hit single, Think Of Me, and what it’s like to become very very famous when you’re just teenagers. Thanks so much to today’s sponsors, Forever New, for making this episode possible.

item.title: Cancelling cancel culture | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Monday fam! Hello! Welcome back. On today’s show: Justin Bieber’s strange defence of Chris Brown, The Sports Illustrated shoot that sparked quite a conversation in our Facebook group and the proliferation of cancel culture: Why don’t we ever let people muck up without demanding they die? To read Sophie Aubrey’s piece on Sri Lanka, you can here. Shameless is a production of Shameless Media. Transcript

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Laura Byrne | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description This week on the show, we are joined by the absolutely delightful Laura Byrne. You might remember Laura from her time on The Bachelor, where she won Matty J’s heart and the affection of the country, too.
