Outside of reality television though, Laura runs Toni May, a jewellery company full of hand-crafted pieces that started selling at markets for a fun outside of her day job. We meet a lot of people in this job, but we have to say, Laura is one of the kindest, warmest, most down to earth women we’ve had the pleasure of chatting to.

item.title: Bad dating and back tattoos | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday beautiful people! Coming up on today’s show: Instagram toys with a future without likes, while Bachelor in Paradise shows us the difference between love and obsession. Plus, what did we think about Taylor Swift’s new single, ME? Thanks to this week’s sponsor Goodness Me Box for making this episode of Shameless possible. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ at checkout to receive $10 off your first order. This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Natalie Fornasier | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today, we are joined by a person who has influenced Zara and I more than any “Instagram influencer” or “YouTube vlogger” ever has. Her name is Natalie Fornasier, and she has 839 Instagram followers. Your eyebrows might be raised right now, and you might be wondering how a normal Sydney girl with a normal social media following could be so influential. Well, last year, Natalie sat down with Byrdie.

item.title: The Influencer Olympics | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday! And it’s a public holiday too! Happy Easter lovely people. On today’s show: the Queen of PR might be getting her own reality TV show. Plus, we get into the nitty gritty of the Influencer Olympics, otherwise known as Coachella, and the machinations of why Lara Bingle was slut-shamed out of the country. You can check out the podcast Gertie’s Law here. For 15% off Harlequin Belle products, use the code SHAMELESS at https://www.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rowi Singh | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy In Conversation Thursday lovely people! On today’s show, we are joined with Rowi Singh. It’s hard to condense what and who Rowi is in a quick soundbite, but we will give it a shot. Rowi is an influencer, yes, but she’s not your average influencer. She might have more than a hundred thousand followers on Instagram, but she’s not about detox teas and teeth whitener. Instead, Rowi’s brand is her creativity.

item.title: Alex, Richie, and reading between the lines | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday Shameless community! Coming up on today’s episode - the scam that’s sweeping across Instagram. Plus, the Bachelor In Paradise conversation that the country is talking about… without actually talking about it at all, and the influencer and alcohol debate that has us just a little confused. Want to follow us on Insta? Find us @shamelesspodcast. Only if you want to, though. No pressure. Kinda. Not desperate at all, promise.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: DJ Tigerlily | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Haaaaappy Thursday friends! Wow, do we have a treat for you today. If you’ve ever been to a nightclub, or a music festival, the chances are you know the name, but perhaps you don’t know the story behind one of our country’s most successful musical exports. In this chat, we explore who DJ Tigerlily is - yes - but we also get to know Dara Hayes, the woman behind the elaborate wigs and costumes.

item.title: Baby, baby, baby, no | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hey hey it’s MONDAY! On today’s show: Kourtney Kardashian has a new venture, and absolutely no one is convinced by it. Justin Bieber jokes about pregnancy to suitable backlash, and Married at First Sight’s Mike says it’s a hard time to be a man. Let’s…. Unpack that. Michelle recommends How Nora McInerny Gets It Done on The Cut On Tuesdays and Zara recommends The Agony of being Theresa May by The Daily.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Effie Kats | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Today we are joined by the force of nature that is Effie Kats. For those unfamiliar, Effie is a design powerhouse. She’s the brains behind her self-titled bespoke suiting brand, as well as Bayse Brand for perfectly cut basics and Dead End Lovers, the home of gorgeous jewellery. But the road to here wasn’t an easy one. At 23, she created cult brand Zachary The Label. Four years later, she lost everything.

item.title: Say my name, say my name | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY LOVERS! Firstly, thank you to everyone who came to our live shows on Thursday and Friday. We have so much love for each and every one of you. Coming up on today’s show: we have a new Bachelorette! Plus, how baby names have become a marker of status, and the royal cheating rumours that have piqued our interest. Thank you to Goodness Me Box for sponsoring this episode of Shameless.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tully Smyth | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description If you don’t know Tully Smyth by name, we will bet you know her story. Rising to fast fame on Big Brother, Smyth found herself the centre of one of the original international and viral storms, after entering into a relationship with a fellow contestant while still having a girlfriend on the outside. Some six years later, Tully Smyth has proved to be far more than her Big Brother story.

item.title: Claws and catfights | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HOLA! Can you bloody believe it’s the week of our first live shows? Ha. We definitely can’t. On today’s show: Are we all a little too obsessed with food delivery apps? Plus, why celebrity “cat fights” are bullshit and the AFL Women’s photo that made waves around the country. Want to sign up to our newsletter? You can! Right here! This episode was produced by Zara McDonald. Transcript

item.title: #InstagramDown | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Gooooood morning Shameless friends! We are so delighted to have you. Coming up on today’s show: WTAF do we do with men like Pete Evans? How #InstagramDown made us confront our dependence on a single company in Silicon Valley, and the College cheating scandal that landed two actresses (and their famous husbands) in some very hot water. Thanks to Frank Body for making this episode of Shameless possible. Want to try the #FrankEffect for yourself?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Michelle Battersby | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello and welcome to this In Conversation episode of Shameless. Today we are joined by one of the leading women in Australia’s tech industry, Michelle Battersby. Michelle is the force behind Bumble Australia, and will be instrumental in the brands push into the Asia Pacific region. Here, we talk about the forces that shaped her from childhood, what drives her, and the machinations behind fostering a cult brand.

item.title: Returning to Neverland | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome back to the week, lovely Shameless people. On today’s show: Ashy Bines has landed herself in another scandal and are we really betting on weight loss now? Plus, the horrifying Michael Jackson documentary that everyone’s talking about, and, finally, has political correctness ruined comedy? If you’d love to check out Happy Skin Co’s at-home laser treatment, use the code SHAMELESS for $50 off at checkout. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: Take a seat at our red table | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday gorgeous Shameless family! Coming up on today’s show: why are drugs suddenly being used to market products to millennials? What should we take away from the Jordyn Woods red table talk? And, finally, how pop-culture and bi-erasure intersect. Read Billi Fitzsimons’ hilarious story on influencer invasions: https://www.mamamia.com.au/instagram-influencer/ Pop-culture is afraid of bisexuality: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/sep/23/popular-culture-afraid-of-bisexuality-john-constantine Watch the ‘Bi the way, we exist’ TED Talk: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XMbfDV55kmc Thanks so much to Goodness Me Box for being today’s sponsor; use the code SHAMELESS to get your first box for just $15.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jamila Rizvi | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description This week on the show, there’s a little less of the dumb stuff because we are joined by the inimitable Jamila Rizvi. In her own words, Jamila is an author, presenter and political commentator. She is is author of the best-selling Not Just Lucky, a career manifesto for millennial women and The Motherhood, an anthology of letters about life with a newborn. Jamila is currently Editor-at-Large of the Nine Network’s Future Women where you may have heard her as host of their podcast Future Women Weekly.

item.title: Get in the bin, Tristan | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Oscars Monday! On today’s show: the Kardashian cheating controversy that became the world’s biggest meme, what Karl Lagerfeld’s death says about erasure and legacy, and a look at Hollywood’s night of nights, The Oscars. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald. Transcript

item.title: More MAFS madness | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday beautiful people! Coming up on today’s show: the strange rumour surrounding Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga, the Married At First Sight storyline that went far beyond the realms of entertainment and the money op-ed that stole our attention this week. Bek Day for WHIMN: https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/tv/reality-tv/married-at-first-sight/the-huge-problem-with-mafs-villain-ines-were-all-ignoring/news-story/9599d673f0da47b4f309f6cd2a24c6bc ‘Domestic violence doesn’t just happen to women’ in The Conversation: https://theconversation.com/domestic-violence-doesnt-just-happen-to-women-95246 Why does it feel like everyone has more money than you, by Jen Doll: https://www.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Laura Henshaw | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description This week we’re joined by the incomparable Laura Henshaw; a fitness entrepreneur, law student, model, and all-round ray of sunshine. To follow Laura on Instagram, search @laura.henshaw. You can also find her on @keepitcleaner. TO VOTE FOR US IN THE AUS POD AWARDS (today is the last day eeeeek!!) go here: https://auspodcastawards.awardsplatform.com/entry/vote/VWzRQJWw/GzrkdLQx?search=0adc6ce1f533f3e8-1 Transcript

item.title: A new kind of ‘it’ girl | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEPPI MONDAY FRIENDS. On today’s show: The celery juice trend we can’t quite escape, the celebrities who have launched one big marriage debate, and the cult-like pull of Instagram sensation Shani Grimmond. You can find the We Met at Acme episode with Caroline Calloway here, and The Cut’s piece on changing our names at marriage here. Sign up to the Shameless weekly newsletter here: https://tinyletter.com/ShamelessPodcast Find tickets to our live show at this link (they will go live on 11/02/19 at 12pm): https://www.

item.title: The fall of a makeup mogul | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday friends! Coming up on today’s episode: the protective brother trope on Married At First Sight, the fall of an Aussie makeup icon, and why Ariana Grande is being sued over a candle. Well, kind of. Mich recommended the period tracking app Flo this week. Read Katy Hall’s incredible piece of journalism here: https://www.couriermail.com.au/entertainment/television/mafs-2019-jessika-powers-brother-rhyce-has-a-restraining-order-against-him-as-he-denies-abuse-claims/news-story/6acf8d81617df53ebf76e8031eaa867c Read here for the New York Times’ piece on fashion and copyright: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/business/kiini-bikini-lawsuit-ipek-irgit-solange-ferrarini.html

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Carly Findlay | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Most people would introduce Carly as a disability advocate, and they’d be right, but she’s also so much more than that: she’s an author, a podcaster, and a generally wonderful human being. In this chat, which took place in the very trendy suburb of Brunswick, we talk about friendships and loneliness, what it’s like to bump into your school bully, and the people who try to “cure” her genetic condition.

item.title: All hail Queen Anna | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It might be a public holiday but we are here and we are so happy to be. On today’s show: The machinations of celebrity feuds, and why the one between Kim Kardashian and Taylor Swift is over for good. Plus, the icon that is Anna Wintour, and how trolling online will soon be considered illegal. You can vote for the Aus Podcast awards here: https://bit.ly/2DCjaal This episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: #UltraToneDeaf | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday! On today’s show: Chris Pratt is engaged after being single for what feels like two minutes, so why in the world do we care? Plus, the influencers abusing their power for no good and the UltraTune ads we are finally ready to fight back on. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald. Transcript

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Annie Nolan | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to our very first In Conversation of 2019 with the incomparable Annie Nolan. You can find Annie on Instagram here, and her own podcast We Want To Be Better here. Also! If you fancy giving her bestie Bianka a follow, you can here. ENJOY x Transcript

item.title: To share or not to share | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Guess who’s back, back again. We are back. Don’t tell Zara I wrote this. Guess who’s back, guess who’s back, guess who’s back, guess who’s back. YEP! It’s 2019 and we are keen to talk about a few things, like: Why is Em Rusciano mad? What in the WHAT is a v-string bikini? Does mummy blogging cross the line? And did Kendall Jenner just save the world with a Proactiv ad?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: You guys! | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Before we say anything else, thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you for listening to our podcast and supporting us in 2018. We love bringing you new content every week - it’s not always easy, but it is so incredibly fulfilling and enjoyable. We are now on a bit of a break until January 14. Until then, you can keep up to date on all things pop culture and celebrity in our Facebook Group ‘Shameless Podcast Community’, or by following us on Instagram @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: Leave Love Actually alone | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Merry Christmas listener friends! We need to talk about Karl Stefanovic’s unceremonious dumping from TODAY, the Love Actually debate that’s making us feel slightly exhausted, and the tricky terrain of tanning culture. Listen to Allison P. Davis on Longform here: https://longform.org/posts/longform-podcast-323-allison-p-davis I For those interested, here is Molly Ringwald’s piece revisiting The Breakfast Club, decades on: https://www.newyorker.com/culture/personal-history/what-about-the-breakfast-club-molly-ringwald-metoo-john-hughes-pretty-in-pink Feel like you’ll miss us over the next fortnight? You can catch us on Instagram @shamelesspodcast or join our Facebook group by searching ‘Shameless Podcast Community’!

item.title: Kendall Jenner’s favourite dress | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Well, well, well it’s the second last episode of the year and what a year it’s been. On today’s show: The strange case of the Daily Telegraph trying to take on an influencer for doing their job, Kendall Jenner takes the red carpet in another naked dress and the Miss Universe controversy making international headlines. For our last In Conversation episode of 2018, we’re giving the mic to YOU!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sarah Holloway | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome back to our third interview episode of Shameless! This week, we’re joined by lawyer-turned-entrepreneur, Sarah Holloway. Sarah is the brains behind global tea brand Matcha Maiden and award-winning cafe Matcha Mylkbar. We chatted about her being adopted from South Korea as a baby, rejecting one of the most prestigious offers a lawyer can get, and working alongside her fiancé. If you love Sarah as much as we do, you can follow her on Instagram @spoonful_of_sarah, or subscribe to her amazing podcast, Seize The Yay.

item.title: The perfect Instagram wedding | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday Shameless fam! This week we need to talk about The Teacher’s Pet, Instagram weddings, and the triumphant rise of Ariana Grande. Want to support the TAC and push fellow Victorians to drive safely this Christmas? Visit the display in Southbank, right near the Meat + Wine Co. We strongly recommend you read Caroline Overington’s piece on The Teacher’s Pet. Click here for Andrew Brown’s take on everything that’s wrong with weddings.

item.title: Narcissists anonymous | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description OKAY you guys, it’s Monday, so let’s do this. On today’s: Lena Dunham seems to be a PR comeback tour of sorts, but is it working? Plus, why influencers are slowly losing us online and how the environment is sparking a YouTube movement. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound. Transcript

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Olivia Rogers | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome back to our very special In Conversation episode of Shameless.Today we are joined by the very talented Olivia Rogers, who you may well know as last year’s Miss Universe Australia. There is, you should know, far more to Liv than being a beauty queen. She’s a speech pathologist, this year’s VRC ambassador for the Melbourne Cup, an occasional model and owner of Melbourne’s cutest dog. We think you’ll love it (and her).

item.title: The Roxy Jacenko show | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO GUYS. MICH HERE. VERRRRRY SLEEP DEPRIVED RIGHT NOW. On this ep we talk about the Diet Prada + Dolce and Gabbana scandal, why Roxy Jacenko has a hold on the Aussie media, and all about our obsession with The Bold Type. Wanna subscribe to our newsletter? You can do so here (if that link doesn’t work, you’ll find it in our Insta bio). Want to get behind the #OrangeCard?

item.title: Em Rata and naked feminism | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday! Thanks so much for joining us. On today’s show: The Bachelorette finale that fell just a little bit flat, the sudden controversy around Emily Ratajkowski’s Australian visit and the mounting pressure for young people to make something of their weekends. This week, Mich recommended Treading Water by Leigh Campbell, and Zara recommended Believed by NPR. Thanks so much to Over The Moo for sponsoring this episode of Shameless.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Emma Hawkins | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Welcome to our very first Thursday instalment of Shameless. Every few weeks or so, we will be dropping interviews with some of the your favourite faces on social media. Up first, it’s Emma Hawkins. You can find Emma on Instagram @emmahawkins_ or you can find her at emmahawkins.com. ENJOY x Transcript

item.title: Inside the Birdcage | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh my goodness WHAT A WEEK! On this episode we’re covering the bachelorettes who can’t help but spread dangerous health advice, whether or not the Melbourne Cup Carnival is unethical (and our experience in the Birdcage) and, finally, the Victoria’s Secret Catwalk. RECOMMENDATIONS: This week, Mich recommended this episode of the The Tim Ferriss Show podcast with Seth Godin. Zara recommended the fiction book Normal People by Sally Rooney.

item.title: The psychology of hate-following | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HAPPY MONDAY wonderful humans, boy do we have a show for you today. First, we need to talk about J-Lo and that glittery green cape. Then, Charlie-Sheen-related-frustration makes Mich cry, and we look at the phenomenon of hate-following. The piece Zara recommended on outrage culture is here. The No Filter episode about James Packer’s life is here. The Cut on Tuesdays’ episode on extremism is here. Listen to Tim Ferriss in conversation with Karlie Kloss here.

item.title: Kayla Itsines and her $486 million | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Monday! Happy Monday! On today’s show: How Kayla Itsines built a $400 million empire despite the controversies that shadow her fiance and business partner. Plus, the influencers who preach career advice in books, and why are women so obsessed with true crime? You read about Zara’s report on Kayla ripping off costumers here, and the AFR’s Young Rich list here. This week, Mich recommended Man Repeller and Zara recommended The Cut On Tuesdays.

item.title: Stalkers, paps, and liars | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday lovers! This week, we’re talking about the evolution of Lady Gaga, the closure of Cosmo, and the ethics of the celebrity paparazzi. This week Mich recommends watching Exposed: The case of Keli Lane on ABC iView. Zara recommends this profile on Chrissy Teigen and this interview with the man who welcomed back Louis CK, To read Allie Jones’ take on whether Cosmo is “deeply feminist”, click here.

item.title: Crazy Rich Australians | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning lovely people. Happy Monday! On this week’s show: Taylor Swift finally gets political, why this year’s season of The Bachelorette is the lowest rating in history, and the Aussie socialites that are dripping with both money and narcissism. This week, Zara recommended Longform’s interview with Rebecca Traister and Michelle recommended Any Ordinary Day by Leigh Sales. Wanna read what we spoke about in the pod? Links below.

item.title: The. Worst. Bachelor. Ever. | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Good morning to everyone except Nick Cummins! Kidding, kidding. In all seriousness, though, what the HECK happened on The Bachelor last week? Plus, can you be a feminist and love rap music, and what’s with the return of the noughties’ biggest Hollywood stars? Mischa Barton and Lindsay Lohan are ev-er-y-where. Our recommendations for the week: How To Be Perfect by Holly Wainwright and Nine Perfect Strangers by Liane Moriarty.

item.title: The case for worst dressed lists | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description As always lovely people, happy Monday! This week: Are WAG best and worst dressed lists inherently anti-feminist? Plus, the brands that are trying to sell products on the back of mental illness, and why the world is obsessed with actress Jameela Jamil. Some stories we mentioned today: The Anxiety That Binds - https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/11/style/anxiety-love-carmen-maria-machado.html Why companies like Bumble and 7-Eleven are trying to sell you skin care and makeup - https://www.

item.title: The rise and rise of Zoe Foster Blake | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello beautiful listener people. Happy Monday! On this week’s episode we’re talking about the floss bikini, the unencumbered success of Zoe Foster Blake, and the sexting scandal that rocked the NRL. To read Mich’s piece on ZFB and Roxy Jacenko, click here. To join our gorgeous Facebook group, click here. To follow us on Insta, click here. To claim $1,000,000 from a Nigerian prince, click here. (Ha! Gotcha.)

item.title: It’s time to talk about the Bachelor villains | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hola! On this week’s show: Did Chrissy Teigen finally give us an opportunity to talk about drinking alcohol in excess, the women whose reputations are ruined by their tenure on reality television and Cosmopolitan cover that’s generated more discussion than almost any other cover this year. You can find Sali Hughes piece about the Tess Holliday cover here, and Wil Anderson’s conversation with Jules Lund here. To follow us on Instagram, click here.

item.title: The celebrity guide to splitting up | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s Monday morning and while that means the weekly grind is churning again, we’re happy to ease the pain with another episode. On this week’s show: Why everyone’s getting sick of The Bachelor, what on Earth do we do with men in the public eye who have fucked up, and the breakup statements so saccharine we feel a little queasy. You can read Clementine Ford’s piece on Louis C.

item.title: Beauty YouTubers and their ugly tweets | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description GDAY! On today’s ep, we look at the Asia Argento sexual assault scandal, male beauty standards, and the epic beauty YouTuber feud we couldn’t look away from. To watch Ta-Nehisi Coates explain why the ‘N’ word doesn’t belong to white people, listen here. To follow us on Instagram, click here. To join our wonderful little Facebook group, click here. If you guys could share a snap listening to this ep on your Instagram story, we would SO APPRECIATE IT.

item.title: The tear-down of Tammy Hembrow | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Heyo! It’s Monday. Happy Monday! It’s a big show for you and it starts where it obviously should: Is this year’s Bachelor a tiny bit problematic? Mich says no, Zara says maybe. We also debrief on Four Corner’s brilliant investigation in cosmetic surgery and influencers, and the subsequent response of our country’s biggest beauty bloggers to the furore. If you’re interested in watching, check it out here. Plus, the story that put Tammy Hembrow on the international stage this week - and not in a good way.

item.title: Sam, Tara and messy public break ups | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Happy Monday! Of course, it wouldn’t be a recap of this week without a pretty comprehensive about one of the ugliest reality TV break ups in recent memory: What is it about these allegations of emotional and physical abuse that make us so uncomfortable? Plus, the messy, messy divorce between Brad and Angelina escalated this week as both leaked like crazy. Oh, and are anonymous gossip Instagram accounts good for the world or an exercise in bullying?

item.title: Media killed the reality star | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello lovely humans! Welcome to episode 22, where we deep dive on Beyonce and Vogue, Married At First Sight’s Tracey Jewel, and Jen Aniston being single and childless in 2018. The short-but-sweet Guardian piece about POC in the fashion industry is here. Mich’s piece on Bachelor’s Ryan licking his lips/teeth/etc is here. As for content on Laura Brown! Mia Freedman’s No Filter episode is here, the terrific SMH profile is here, and her boyfriend’s hilarious writing is here.

item.title: A message for wellness warriors | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Guess what! We back! After a month off regular programming, we’ve resumed our normal eps and woweeeee did we have some things to discuss. Yes, once again, it’s time to chat about wellness warriors and dangerous messages of some of the most influential. Plus, the moment Channel 10 inadvertently told a country of women they just weren’t very funny and how the response to Demi Lovato’s reported overdose shines a harsh light on how we consider celebrity addiction.

item.title: Justin Bieber's hold on women | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hi guys! On today’s show: Why women still love Justin Bieber, a deep-dive on why we never call Beyonce a genius, and how YouTubers are slowly losing touch with reality. To read Caity Weaver’s brilliant profile on Bieber, read here. Lainey Gossip’s piece on Beyonce and the descriptor ‘genius’ is here. And JaackMaate’s take on that Alfie Deyes video is here. As always, you’re so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group!

item.title: The evolution of Steph Claire Smith | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Steph Claire Smith is well-known for her presence on Instagram, but how has her approach to the platform changed as her following has boomed? We get her onto the show to ask her about the finite details of a social media presence that demands engagement of young girls. PLUS! Sylvia Jeffreys called out Woman’s Day this week for posting lies about her relationship, so how in the world do they get away with publishing utter lies?

item.title: Kate Spade and clickbait culture | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello listener friends! Coming up on today’s show: How did the media do in handling the tragic suicide of Kate Spade? The coverage was pretty deplorable if you ask us. Plus, does Miss America dumping the swimsuit section from their competitions mean pageants are feminist? AND we really need to deep dive into the strange underground world of female fitness influencers injecting themselves with steroids. If you would like to skip our segment on Kate Spade and suicide, please pick back up at 35m 15s.

item.title: Gotta sign that NDA | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Don’t mess with celebrities and their clandestine sex lives; such was the message that come through this week, thanks to Love Island. Contestant Natasha not-so-subtly hinted to spending “two nights” with old mate Justin Bieber, but she’ll be damned if she tells us much more. So what’s the deal with water-tight NDAs around both sex and abuse? Plus, Hugh Grant was married this week in a spectacularly low-key affair, so is he officially Britain’s most reluctant celebrity?

item.title: Love Island Australia is white. Too white | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description In case you missed it, 2Day FM radio star Em Rusciano isn’t here to be meek and mild. The presenter and comedian has been at the centre of a media storm this week, and we can’t help but feel like the entire debacle is a little bit gendered. We also dive into what Love Island Australia will be like (… can we have just a TINY BIT of diversity, please?

item.title: It's a royal wedding extravaganza | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s like Christmas, but better (!!!) with fashion and weddings and grandeur and tabloid drama. Yes, it’s royal wedding week and we’ll be damned if we aren’t spending (almost) the whole show on it. From the Great Markle Debacle to the dress of the century to the aisle walk that demanded more headlines than the wedding itself: We go deep and wide and, well, everywhere. Plus, Kim Kardashian’s sucky (ha) Instagram post that landed her in a boiling pot of hot water.

item.title: When a lie goes viral | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Dearly beloved! We are gathered here today to debrief on Scarlett Johansson’s MET Gala move, the strange, widely reported rumours about the state of Tammy Hembrow’s relationship, and Chrissy Teigen’s ultimate branding conundrum. You can read Mich’s post on Sarah’s Day here. Vogue’s glowing profile on Georgina Chapman here. And, finally, The Cut’s chat about being a cool girl with Chrissy Teigen here. And don’t forget, you can take part in the conversation by joining our Facebook group!

item.title: Fact checking a "healing princess" | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description It’s episode 9! Bloody hell, doesn’t time fly? This week we have a little chat on the announcement of Ali Oetjen as Australia’s newest Bachelorette and our… mixed feelings about it. Also, the problematic wellness influencer who says she treated her precancerous cells naturally, and the glittery phenomenon that is dubbed “the party of the year”, the MET gala. UPDATE: After recording this episode we also received a statement from Dr Brad McKay, a family doctor from East Sydney Doctors, about Sarah Stevenson’s claims.

item.title: From model to influencer to entrepreneur | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Hello friends! Happy Monday/Shameless day! This week we’re going deep on the fitness feud between KIC’s Steph Claire Smith and Laura Henshaw, and 28’s Sam Wood (by interviewing none other than the lovely Laura about it). THEN we discuss all things Kanye, Kanye, Kanye and whether or not it’s problematic to list a 14-year-old in the world’s top 100 most influential people. Want to join in on the action?

item.title: The making of a reality TV villain | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HEY. Welcome back! We’re so happy to have you here. We’re going just a liiiiiiittle bit rogue this week and changing things up. Yeeeep, we’re interviewing former Bachelor star Jen Hawke - also known as Australia’s favourite reality TV villain - about the power of the producer. Can a reality TV producer create a villain, we ask her, or do they need something to actually play with in order to craft their character?

item.title: Going deep on Khloe Kardashian and 'Third Trimester Tristan' | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description OH MY GOODNESS. This week we obviously needed to debrief on the Khloe Kardashian/Tristan Thompson cheating saga. We went deeeeeep (and got a little fiery with each other along the way) on how much sympathy should we have for Khloe, and the men like Tristan who just can’t keep it in their pants. Also: we cover the cultural phenomenon that is Coachella, and the musical phenomenon that is Cardi B.

item.title: Celebrity divorce and the great Instagram lie | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Well, it’s been a big week in the world of celebrity divorce after Jenna Dewan and Channing Tatum announced their “loving” split to the cries of love being dead. So why is it we feel so viscerally about break-ups like this? Is it because we feel we’ve being sold a lie about what a relationship and a break up looks like? Plus, a radio host’s orgasm story that was a little bit too much to stomach and the atrocity that is Meghan Markle daring to have a grey hair.

item.title: Georgia Love is tearing the whole thing down | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HELLO! This week we’re doing things a little differently - we’re interviewing Georgia Love! The journalist and former Bachelorette issued a blistering tweet to a women’s tabloid mag this week, so we had a chat with her about it. Also, we need to get to the bottom of why a celebrity BIT BEYONCE ON THE FACE and whether or not it’s creepy for Scott Disick to be dating a teenager.

item.title: Oops! Britney did it again. And again | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description HOLA! Welcome back. Bachelor in Paradise started this week, so naturally, we took it upon ourselves to debrief all about the show’s premiere. Michelle thinks Davey and Flo will be the first to have sex, Zara thinks she’s wrong and mostly, we talk a whole lot of crap about a show that’s just a whole lot of crap. Loveable crap, that is. We also deep-dive the return of Britney Spears - considering she randomly re-surfaced in our news cycle TWICE this week - and discuss the media’s troubling response to a story about Robin Williams and his larrikin antics on the set of Mork & Mindy.

item.title: Katy Perry kissed a boy and we didn't like it | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Oh hey there! This week, we just needed to debrief about the kiss that landed Katy Perry in some rather hot water, the WAGs who build their careers off the back of heartbreak, and the incredible resurgence of Jennifer Garner. Speaking of Jen Garner, let us know what you think her quotes meant in this Vanity Fair profile: https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/02/jennifer-garner-talks-kids-career-ben-affleck You’re so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group!

item.title: Fashion week is real life Instagram | Shameless
item.description: Podcast Description Ever wondered if Fashion Week is just a big wank fest? Michelle and Zara went down to VAMFF this week to check it all out, and Mich walked away with a few key concerns about the festival. Plus, we deep-dive the months-long saga involving Ryan Seacrest and try to make sense of sexual misconduct allegations that are made public before they’re proven. Oh, and do we have any right to know about Bella Hadid’s face?
